properties.name: Spanish/Iberian Lynx
properties.description: The Spanish Lynx is a large cat, which resembles a bobcat, with leopard-like spots. It lives in the Mediterranean forest and mountainous areas covered in vegetation, like open forests. It is a smaller version of wild cats so it hunts smaller sized animals. The largest animal it preys on is the hare. It also preys on rodents, birds, reptiles and amphibians. It only hunts at twilight. Its main food source is the European rabbit. A male only needs to feed on one rabbit per day, but a female with cubs will eat up to three rabbits per day. However, this is a great characteristic because rabbits repopulate very quickly.It adapts well to the area because it dwells in the shrubs and grass, which provides a type of camouflage. It hunts at twilight, and it does this alone. It will wait for hours behind rocks and bushes to capture prey. Twilight keeps it hidden and that makes it safer from deadly situations, like poachers. It has tufts of hair on its ears to help it detect sounds.http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iberian_Lynx

properties.name: Monk Seal
properties.description: The Monk Seal is found in the Mediterranean and Eastern Atlantic waters, also around the Tropic of Cancer. It feeds on a variety of fish and mollusks. It mostly chooses octopus and squid to feed on. They eat up to 3 kilograms per day. The pups are born in black fur, with a special shaped white patch beneath that is used to identify them.Due to commercial hunting, fishermen, coastal urbanization and pollution , it has to adapt. However, it does adapt very slowly to these conditions. It has advantages of being able to emerge itself to depths of 150 to 230 feet. This keeps it protected from the human activities that are destroying its species. The newest adaptation would be having pups in coastal caves. The pups are usually born on land but since humans have populated the land they have to be born elsewhere. The caves are so hard to get to that even trained scuba divers do not go inside. It’s a safer place for the newborns to be born but after birth the caves are a very dangerous place for the pups to be. The caves cause mortality among some pups.http://www.newsfinder.org/site/more/the_mediterranean_monk_seal/

properties.name: Loggerhead Turtle
properties.description: The Loggerhead Turtle lives in the Mediterranean. It feeds on mollusks, crustaceans, fish, jellyfish, crabs, shrimp, Portuguese Man o’ War and other small marine animals. They crush their prey with their large and powerful jaws. Female turtles lay their eggs on the beach. They don’t have bones on the tip of their front legs. A good adaptation for the Loggerhead Turtle is that it can migrate to different areas when it gets too chilly. It can also hibernate as the water cools down. They are submerged under water for up to seven hours at a time. To receive their full amount of air that they need to stay under for seven hours they come up for only seven minutes. They have the longest recorded dives for any air-breathing marine vertebrates.http://www.panda.org/what_we_do/endangered_species/endangered_species_list/marine_turtles/loggerhead_turtle/

properties.name: Mouflon
properties.description: The Mouflon sheep is thought to be one of the ancestors for all modern domestic sheep. It has a red-brown coat with a dark back-stripe. It has light colored saddle patch and underparts. All males have horns and most females also do, but some lack them. They live in the mountainous areas of the Mediterranean. It eats shrub and grass. It has a few adaptations. They can travel to high levels of ground to stay away from predators like bear and wolves. They have horns that also protect them. Their coats protect them from the colder temperatures so they could migrate to a colder area. In 2001 they successfully cloned a mouflon and it survived for seven months. So if they could successfully clone a mouflon and keep it alive, they could easily start to get more technical and clone it to survive in another biome.http://lsb.syr.edu/projects/cyberzoo/mouflonsheep.html

properties.name: Bezoar Goat
properties.description: The Bezoar Goat is covered in coarse wool except for their legs. The common colors of the goats are black, brown, gray, red, and white. They have cloven hooves. Most of them have horns that curve backwards. They have short bears. They eat vegetation. Adaptations for them is their wool which helps it survive harsh mountain climates. It defends itself using its horns. They could easily adapt to another cold environment. http://www.blueplanetbiomes.org/wild_goat.htm

properties.name: Euphorbia wulfenii
properties.description: It’s the most extravagant of the wood spurges. It grows to three feet high to five feet wide. It has beautiful blue-green foliage and chartreuse blooms in the springtime. It helps bowl movements because the poisonous milky sap is used as a laxative. If the poison comes in contact with any mucous membranes it will cause extremely painful inflammation. When experimented with animals it has an irritating effect stronger than the hot substance found in chillies, capsaicin. If you are cutting these plants in a greenhouse you should have extremely well ventilation because several meters away it will cause irritation to air passages and eyes. Keep children and domestic pets away from this plant. Its adaptation is that it is drought tolerant. It does best, actually, with no fertilizer and hardly any water. Since the Mediterranean climate is mostly very dry this is a great plant choice. That is why I chose this plant.http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Euphorbia

properties.name: Artemisia
properties.description: It is a plant whose growth dies down annually but whose roots and underground parts stay alive. It has a hard and woody continuously growing stem. The stem is growing to .8-1.2 meters tall. It is grooved, branched, and silvery-green. The leaves on the Artemisia are arranged in a spirally fashion and are greenish-grey on the top and white below. It is covered with silky silvery-white hairs. It bears oil-producing glands. The flowers on it are pale yellow and tubular. It flowers from early summer to early autumn. It is pollinated by the wind flow. It has fruit that is small, dry and contains one seed. The plants strong odor can be used for making a plant spray to guard off pests. It also can be used to repel fleas and moths indoors. It also is an ingredient in the liquor, absinthe. Its used for flavoring spirits and wines. I chose it because it helps humans so well in medicinal purposes. It’s medically used as a tonic, stomachic, antiseptic, antispasmodic, carminative, cholagogue, febrifue and anthemlmintic. When the flowers dry it is used for indigestion and gastric pain. The herb in the plant is used for tea that helps pregnant women with labor pain. Wine can also be made from the herb. The oil, when used in proper dosages, can be used to improve blood circulation. One adaptation is that it grows on uncultivated, dry ground. It also grows on rocky slops and on the edge of footpaths and fields. It would probably be very easy to plant these elsewhere in another dry climate.http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Artemisia_absinthium

properties.name: Lavatera maritima
properties.description: This plant can grow up to four feet tall to six feet wide. It has maple-like foliage. It is a gray-green shade. The color always stays the same through all the seasons. The flowers that grow are purple and saucer-shaped. The inner flower, or throat, is a beautiful deep purple. It’s adaption is that it can grow in full sun. It only needs occasional water. It can be found in an altitude up to 1,478 meters, which is 4,849 feet. I choose this plant because it is very beautiful and it can survive in hot/dry climates.http://zipcodezoo.com/Plants/L/Lavatera_maritima/

properties.name: Silverdust Glow
properties.description: It is a daisy-like flower that has a silvery underside. When planted in mass they double as a weed suppressant. This is why I chose this plant. Their colors vary from reds, oranges, yellows, deep purples, blues, greens and silvers. It has adaptations to the dry tolerant weather once it is established. They rely on sunshine to open fully. They are ideal for low maintenance areas.http://www.pga.com.au/view_plant.asp?plant_id=35

properties.name: Buddleja
properties.description: The butterfly bush got its name because of the butterflies attraction to it. Bees, moths and ladybirds, are also attracted to it. When they flower with a red shade hummingbirds become attracted to it. They can get up to 6’-12’ tall and have a spread of 4’-15’ in warm climates, such as the mediterranean. The flower colors are purple, rose, magenta or white. It’s a very great flower to put in a garden if you want to enjoy the beautiful variety of butterflies it will attract.The butterfly bush grows well in warm climates because in the winter they die down. It better adapts to warmer climates if you want it stay blooming. I chose this because it attracts many different kinds of beautiful animals like the ones listed above.http://home.howstuffworks.com/define-butterfly-bush.htm

properties.name: Striped Hyena
properties.description: They are also referred to as the Barbary hyena. It is found Africa, Arabia, Asia Minor, and India. They have their own family called Hyaenidae. Their bodies are very adorable. They have broad heads, dark eyes, thick muzzles, large and pointy ears and black stripes. Their coat varies from gray to light brown. Their front legs are longer than their back legs. They have a mane of long hair that can be raised to make them look larger. They use this intimidation when they feel confronted or threatened. They have fluffy tails that grow over a foot long. Strangely, the females are larger than the males. They like to be around a water source, usually within six miles. They usually stay alone or with a dominant female. They feed on dead animals that other predators kill. They eat insects, small mammals, reptiles, eggs, fruit, and vegetables. Females have a gestation period of three months and will give birth to two or four young.The reason this species is endangered is because of loss of habitat and hunting. Hyenas can kill humans, especially children, and also livestock so they are usually trapped and killed. Some people believe that their organs have medicinal value so they kill them.http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Striped_Hyenahttp://www.earthsendangered.com/profile.asp?ID=1&sp=201

properties.name: Barbary Several
properties.description: They are wild cats only found in Algeria. Their bodies are slender with long legs and a fairly short tail. They have small round heads with ears that set close together. Their coats are usually pale yellow with black spots and bands. They have the largest ears and legs relative to their body size in the cat family. They are excellent at jumping up to ten feet high. This characteristic helps them hunt very well. They have a great sense of hearing and vision. They also can climb trees exceptionally well. When predators are discovered they just climb up the nearest tree. They like to have water sources near by them so they can be easily nourished. They are active during night and in the day they rest. Their diet consists of birds, lizards, insects, frogs, rodents and other small animals. Like most other cats, they mark their territory with their scent. Usually they stay alone unless it’s for mating. The females have a gestation period of 67-77 days and give birth to up to five young. She takes care of them for about eight months. Other species of the serval are not extinct but the Barbary are endangered and may already be extinct. The reason they are in such danger is because of wrongful human activity. Hunters, for their skin, kill them. Farmers ill-treat them because they can kill livestock. They are also captured for pet trade. International law regulates commercial trade of them.http://www.earthsendangered.com/profile.asp?IDsp=418

properties.name: European Rabbit
properties.description: The Mediterranean is already known as a global hotspot, which means it's experiencing major habitat loss. If the keystone species would decline it would alter the ecological relationships of the ecosystem. European rabbits are the keystone species for the Mediterranean. They dig burrows called warrens, in which they go in while they are not out feeding. The young are born blind and furless but the mother lines the warren in fur and takes care of them. They are small and vary in color from gray to dark brown. They have two sharp incisors on the top and two on the bottom that continuously grow. They have large ears and hind legs, short, fluffy tails and long toes. Their toes are webbed to prevent them spreading apart as they hop around. They are very social within their species so they live together in medium-sized colonies. They are mostly active around dusk and dawn. Grass is their primary food source. Female rabbits have a gestation period of 29-35 days. Every litter has from two to twelve rabbits! In a study, twenty-four rabbits multiplied to over 600 million rabbits in less than a century. These rabbits alter the mixture of plants and structure of vegetation while through grazing and spreading the seeds over a wide area. This helps preserve the plant species. Rabbit's waste have a good effect on soil fertility and plant growth. It provides new feeding resources for invertebrate species. The burrows provide nest sites and shelter for other animals. Rabbits are prey for a lot of the predators in the mediterranean, including the Spanish Lynx and Spanish Imperial Eagle. They are a great keystone species in my opinion.http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/European_rabbit

properties.name: Landforms/Unique Characteristics
properties.description: A unique landform of the Mediterranean is Table Mountain. Table Mountain is located in Cape Town, South America. It’s a flat-topped mountain that is part of the Table Mountain National Park. The top of the mountain is usually covered with fog, or mist that resembles a “table cloth”. A Mount Etna is an active stratovolcano. This means that it is steep and has periodic eruptions. It is found in the east coast of Sicily. It’s the largest active volcano in Europe. Its height is 10,922 feet. Its last eruption ended on November 13, 2008. It lasted for six months, being the longest eruption Mount Etna ever had.http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Table_Mountain

properties.name: Human Use Of Biome
properties.description: In the Mediterranean people use the biome for many things, usually to make a profit. The art of plant cultivation is a large reason this biome is being used. They ruin the soil by using the same soil to plant their crops in, but eventually they won’t even be able to use the soil. They use them for vineyards, olive grooves, orchards, and range lands. If they keep using the land without nourishing it, it will ruin the health of the soil and they won’t be able to plant anything. This could cause less money for farmers, less food source for everyone, and most importantly, hurt the biome.http://mrsmaine.wikispaces.com/Mediterranean+Forest+and+Grassland

properties.name: Agricultural in the Biome
properties.description: The olive is an evergreen tree in the Mediterranean. It’s used for its fruit and the oil produced from the fruit. 95% of the world’s olive cultivation is in the Mediterranean. 90% of these trees are grown for the olive oil. You can use their oil for cooking. The mandarin is also in the Mediterranean. It is an edible citrus that is easy to peal due to its soft skin. It has a sweet flavor and aroma. You can eat them or use them to make fresh juice. The fig is produced here. It’s very popular because it is high in calcium. The Persimmon is a fruit that varies in colors. The colors are yellow, orange, or red when ripe. From late September to early December it is harvested for dying or fresh marketing. It is very sweet when ripe, but when its not fully ripe it has a very rotten taste. Pomegranate is also produced in the Mediterranean. It is known as the oldest edible fruit. It is truly a false berry that is alike in shape and color. It is shiny red, yellowish-green or whit. It has a hard rind. The fruits seeds have a acid juice in them. The fruits with the hardest seeds are poor for eating. Soft seeds are much better to consume. The hard seeds, however, have a high juice content. Last but not least, the pistachio nut. It is harvested by hand mostly because it is grown in clusters. They can be roasted, salted, shelled or unshelled to eat. They can be found in our day to day lives in ice creams, sweets, cakes, and even meat dishes. The kernels of the nut is very healthy and nutritious. The oils from the nut can also be used in cosmetics and pharmaceuticals. Since the climate is very hot and dry, the soil is also the same. People keep using the soil to plant their crops so each time they do that the soil loses its nutrition. I would classify the soil as extremely poor and dry.http://www.hort.purdue.edu/newcrop/proceedings1996/v3-416.html

properties.name: Tourist Attractions
properties.description: The Museum of Louvre in Paris, France is quite famous. The museum was once a famous palace in which important people, like Phillip the Second lived. On August 10, 1793 the museum began. It had 537 paintings in it. In 1796 they closed it down due to the buildings structure beginning to have faults in it. In 1801 it reopened. It now holds some of the most famous art works of the entire world. Another attraction is the world-wide famous Eiffel Tower. It is a tower made from iron. It is a global icon of France and is one of the most recognizable structures. It was constructed between the years 1887 and 1889. Its roof is 986 feet high and the antenna on top of that is 1,064 feet height. The man who made the beauty of this possible was Gustave Eifeel. I think it is beautiful and I would love to be one of the tourist that attract to it someday.http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Louvre

properties.name: Conservation Efforts
properties.description: There is now a project going on called The Nature Conservancy. Dr. Jeffrey Parish is in charge of the operation. This project is being held in California, Chile, Australia and South Africa. The reason for this project is that the Mediterranean needs assistance. It only covers 2% of the Earth’s land surface, 802 million acres, but it has more than 48,000 or 20% of the world’s vascular plant species. Many of those plants are rare and only found in the Mediterranean. There are five Mediterranean habitats but they are among the most threatened biomes. Since there are dry, warm summers and mild winters it attracts the human population to want to visit or move there. It puts the biome under a lot of pressure to maintain its well-being. It CANNOT do it alone, it needs help, and that is why this conservancy was put together. One example is this conservancy is helping by deciding which type of cultivation is best terrestrial and freshwater. Then when they do decide which is better for the biome by doing research then they will try to help vineyard growers practice this way of cultivation. When the wine is finally made then they will promote buying the earth friendly wine which is helping save a biome.http://www.snre.umich.edu/node/6108

properties.name: Mediterranean Fruit Fly
properties.description: The fruit fly lay their eggs underneath the skin of fruit so the offspring is born inside of its food source. They are native to the mediterranean area. They are capable of doing extreme damage to fruit crops and are a pest to humans. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mediterranean_Fruit_Fly

properties.name: Beaver
properties.description: My first biome animal is the beaver. It lives in the lakes/ponds region because it builds dams to live in. They adapt very well to there surroundings, so when there are predators such as wolfs, coyote, and bears after them they can hide in these dams and be completely unexposed. It is a herbivore, so it only eats plants. These dams are built for and by beavers for living. Beavers are the second largest rodent, after the capybara. Beavers can survive in the water, but it's survives best in it's dam. They are low on the food chain because they are herbivors and are preyed on a lot.Beavers adapt best to lake/pond biomes because they build there homes in lakes/ponds. They also adapt well because the ponds are surrounded by plants that they eat. Lakes/ponds are the beavers natural habitat so of course they can adapt. They barely have the ability to adapt any where else. The places were they can survive is all bodies of water.

properties.name: Brown Trout
properties.description: My second biome animal is the Brown Trout.It is native to Europe and Asia. Even though it survives in the lakes/ponds, it's still is in danger of being killed by fisherman. It comes from the same place as the sea trout. It preys on young brown trout, suckers, sculpins, shad, whitefish and rainbow trout. But the Brown Trout is a prey to animals like bear etc. Humans also are predators towards the Brown Trout.They only can survive in only fresh water. So they cannot survive in oceans. They can't really travel to different biomes on there own. People often stock Brown Trout in lakes or ponds which is really the only travel the Brown Trout gets. They really cant adapt to any other biome in the world because there fresh water fish

properties.name: River Otter
properties.description: My third biome animal is the River Otter. River Otters eat amphibians, fish, turtles, crayfish, crabs, and other invertebrates, birds, their eggs,small terrestrial mammals, and aquatic plants. It is a carnivore. River Otters can be eaten by bobcats, coyotes, birds of prey, alligators, and other large predators. They can usually survive a predation with their agility.They live in any fresh water biome were they can easily get food. They mostly live in Canada or North America but do not live in the south of the United States. Dens have underwater entrances and a tunnel leading to a nest chamber that is lined with leaves, grass, moss, bark, and hair. They can't really adapt to any places other than lakes, ponds, streams, rivers, coastal areas, marsh, swamp, and bog.

properties.name: Shrimp
properties.description: My fourth biome animal is the Shrimp. Shrimp are omnivores they eat plants and small animals. The usually pistol shrimp kills or stuns it's prey by making a very loud sound with it's huge claw. Shrimp are invertibrates, but they have a very tough exoskeleton. The shrimp is classified under arthropoda. They can live very long. One of there biggest predators is us. Other predators are squid, octopi, and cuttlefish.Shrimp can survive in fresh water and salt water. They would survive longer in lakes or ponds then in an ocean because there are many of there predators in the ocean, even people. Usually most shrimp live in the ocean and crawl on the bottom. They can withstand a lot of outer damage because of their tough exoskeletons.

properties.name: Snapping Turtle
properties.description: My fifth biome animal is the Snapping Turtle. It has a diet of plants, small fish, and birds. They can detect a rotting corpse better then most animals. Sometimes cops use them to find dead people. The snapping turtle is a very common house pet. We are actually the Snapping Turtles main predator. They are also very defensive.Snapping Turtles live in fresh water and brackish water. They prefer water bodies and muddy bottoms. They have a lot of economic benefits to humans. These turtles consume many game fish which is a negative. It really cannot adapt to any other biome, they many exist in North America. They can be found in any Lake/Pond.

properties.name: Algae
properties.description: My first biome plant is Algae. I picked Algae because it's one of the view plant in lakes/ponds. The marine forms of Algae is called Seaweed. Algae lacks a lot of characteristics that regular plants obtain. Algae is preyed on by almost every thing in the ocean and is definintely believable that its at the very bottom of the food chain. Its domain is eukaryota. Algae is one of the few plants exist in this biome. It isn't hard for algae to live in different biomes. Although it is a plant, so they can't really get to other biomes in order to survive. It can survive in the ocean. On a trip to the beach you may see a form of algae dried up on shore. So thats the main reason why algae wouldn't exist in every biome.

properties.name: Water Lilies
properties.description: My second biome plant is Water Lilies. Most of the time, when people hear the words "water lilies" they think of lily pads which frogs jump on and transport. Even though that is true, there is more information than that. Water lilies can only exist in lakes and ponds. They look like they are just floating on the surface but they really have roots growing from the water.The list of biomes that water lillies can live in is very short. Waterlilies don't really have a predator, so they live a pretty long time. Really creative artist use water lilies for there art by painting them different colors. Some of the factors that can destroy water lilies are the winter season,humans physically tearing them,and fish may jump onto one forcing it to tear.

properties.name: Fungi
properties.description: My third biome plant is Fungi. Fungi's domain is Eukarya. Fungi is definently a huge predator to humans because it gets in your skin and causes rashes. It is mainly a mold for example if a peach was left out, it would start to crumble, after so many days of rotting, then fungi grows on it making it hard, and rough to touch. The biomes that Fungi can exist are all over the world. You can find fungi anywhere but mainly in the lakes and ponds region. People usually try to eliminate the fungi or avoid it so it won't be transported to them. Fungi is a contagious disease that can spread to other people. Fungi has a rare effect on your skin and is very frustrating to handle. It can exist and adapt to alot of biomes throughout world.

properties.name: Bryophytes
properties.description: My fourth biome plant is Bryophytes. They are basically on the bottom of the food chain. They do not live in the lakes and ponds but they live on the land in the same are as lakes and ponds. Bryology is the branch of plant science concerned with the study of mosses, liverworts and hornworts. They are found growing on soil, rocks, and trees throughout the world. Bryophytes are all embrophytes which are land plants, that are non-vascular: they have tissues and enclosed reproductive systems, but they lack vascular tissue that circulates liquids. They neither have flowers nor produce seeds, reproducing via spores. They can be found anywhere from coastal Antarctica to the peat bogs of the Northern hemisphere, from the deserts of Australia to the rain forests of the Amazon.

properties.name: Seaweed
properties.description: My fifth biome plant is seaweed. Seaweed is basically described as microscopic marin aglae. The domain of seaweed is Eukarya. A seaweed may belong to one of several groups of multicellular algae: the red algae, green algae, and brown algae. The ecology of seaweeds is dominated by two specific environmental requirements. Seaweed can exist in any body of water. They mainly can be found on the beach, some washed up on shore, and some floating in the ocean. Seawead is mostly brown or green in color. Seaweed is in lakes and plonds every where and it can adapt or grow in any place in thar region. There is a large amount of seaweed in the lakes and ponds biome.

properties.name: Blue Pike
properties.description: The Blue Walleye (Sander vitreus glaucus), was a subspecies of the walleye that went extinct in the 1980s. Until the middle of the 20th century, it was a commercially valuable fish with about a half million tonnes being landed during the period from about 1880 to the late 1950s, when the populations collapsed. It is from the Great Lakes region.The reason the Blue Pike is extinct is because they were such a popular fish. So, fisherman over fished the are they were located (the Great Lakes). The amount of Blue Pikes left are none as far as anyone knows. They say that it might exist in small ponds and Canada. Scientist cannot prove this yet because they lack DNA.

properties.name: Deepwater Cisco
properties.description: The Deepwater Cisco (Coregonus johannae) was one of the largest ciscoes in the Great Lakes. Its average length was 30cm (12 inches) and it was about 1.0 kilogram in weight. The Deepwater Cisco was distinguished by usually having less than 33 gill rakers, relatively long pectoral fins, and unpigmented jaws. It was a silvery colour with a pink or purple lustre and a green or blue back.The main reasons for its extinction were overfishing and predation by the Sea Lamprey. There are no real reasons why there extinct. They aren’t often talked about. It was found extinct in 1952.

properties.name: Otter
properties.description: Otters eat amphibians, fish, turtles, crayfish, crabs, and other invertebrates, birds, their eggs, small terrestrial mammals, and aquatic plants. It is a carnivore. Otters can be eaten by bobcats, coyotes, birds of prey, alligators, and other large predators. They can usually survive a predation with their agility.It is known to be keystone species, by controlling sea urchin population which would otherwise inflict extensive damage to kelp forest ecosystems. Its diet includes prey species that are also valued by humans as food, leading to conflicts between sea otters and fisheries. The sea otter is really what is mostly a keystone species.

properties.name: Human Destruction
properties.description: People destroy the lake/pond region by throwing trash into the lakes and possibly destroying the population of fish. Activities that may pollute the lakes are swimming, fishing, sailing, etc. The main pollution of lakes are just people carelessly throwing their garbage into it.Dumping garbage in lakes/ponds effects animals by polluting the water that they swim in. They could also be cut or snagged by garbage laying on the surface and possibly killing species.

properties.name: landforms and human uses
properties.description: The different things that about the landforms of lakes and ponds are land around the coast, shallow water, and deep sea. What changes the landforms is fertilizer in the ground running into the lakes. The landforms are used by humans and animals for living.Human uses of lakes and ponds are swimming, fishing, sailing. Humans use the water for certain things. There are a lot of biomes with freshwater that are beneficial to humans. In some places swimming in ponds is apart of what bring people to the location.

properties.name: agriculture
properties.description: Lakes and Ponds agriculture is very easily explained. Agriculture in ponds and lakes isn’t very large but is considered good by most people. Fishing is the process that receives the food. There are no plants that make food.Fish are the main food that comes from lakes and ponds. Seafood is a big deal every where. Crabs and Shrimp are also some of the main food that comes from lakes and ponds. The place to find fish is the fish market and resteraunts. Seafood can easily be prepared by anyone.

properties.name: conservation acts
properties.description: Lakes and ponds have many conservation efforts. Some of the conservation efforts include DCR, J&L Water, and Minnesota sea grant. Many States have programs to conserve lakes and ponds. For example, Massachusetts has over 3,000 lakes and ponds that have opportunities for recreation and valuable habitat for a wide diversity of plants and animals.These organizations efforts to stop water pollution, violation of lake rules, etc. have been very productive. The main reason people set up these organizations is that they want to prevent dumping trash into lakes and ponds. It helps plants, animals, and people.

properties.name: Backround information
properties.description: Lakes and Ponds are bodies of standing water, which are natural or man made. The lake I used for my place marks is the great lakes located in north United States. Ponds and lakes are distinguished from streams via current speed. The Great Lakes are a chain of freshwater lakes located in eastern North America, on the Canada/United States border. Lakes Michigan and Huron are hydrologically a single lake, sometimes called Lake Michigan-Huron; they have the same surface elevation of 577 feet and are connected not by a river but by the 295-foot deep Straits of Mackinac. The lakes are bound by the Canadian province of Ontario and the U.S. states of Minnesota, Wisconsin, Michigan, Illinois, New York, Indiana, Ohio, and Pennsylvania.

properties.name: Other animals
properties.description: Black SwanCanadian GooseFlamingoMallard DuckNewt

properties.name: River Otter
properties.description: The River otter spends most of its time in the vegetative areas of an estuary, hunting clams, crabs, and small fish. The river otter will often times take their catch out into the middle of the river or bay and tinker with it as it finds the easiest way eat it. Using the cover of the thick vegetation that grows on the outskirts of an estuary, the river otter makes a den by using the tall grasses, rotten foliage and mud giving great cover from predators. The river Otter is able to open the hard surfaces of shell fish, because of its extremely hard teeth, using the as a crowbar of sorts the otter rarely comes across a shell that it cannot open. It also has cupped paws allowing it to swim notably well for a amphibious mammal. Lastly the Otter has extraordinary eye sight, enabling it to see prey through the murky muck of a marsh.

properties.name: Southern Bald Eagle
properties.description: The Southern Bald Eagle is a magnificent Bird of Prey. With the ability to seek a diverse range of food sources, the bald eagle is one of the most versatile birds. What makes the Southern Bald Eagle estrange from its cousins in the north and in the west is that it is attracted to mainly estuarial areas. The Southern Bald Eagle has adapted its hunting techniques to accommodate the Bays, Harbors and Rivers that make up an estuary.   This particular species of Bald Eagle has a couple of very special adaptations that allow it to survive in an estuarial environment. First, the Southern Bald Eagle’s talons are 3 to 4 inches longer than any of its respective cousins allowing it to catch fish that are both bigger and deeper. Also, the beak of this bird is slightly more curved than other Bald Eagles. Finally, because of the generally stable climate of the south, the Southern Bald Eagle will not reduce activities for any particular season, instead it devotes 100% time looking for food so that it can survive.

properties.name: Harbor Seal
properties.description: Harbor seals spend all of their time in the habitat suggests. A Harbor Seal will eat any thing from sea weed to a tuna if the chance is present. Also a harbor seal will lounge on any land form in the middle of its water habitat after it has fed.    Harbor Seals are one of the most unique animals living in an estuary, having some of the most obvious evolutionary changes of most of the mammals, the seal has flippers that have replaced all of the extremities on its body. These metamorphic changes allow the seal to move superbly in water. Another adaptation that the seal possess is a thin covering that comes down over the eyes when submerged in water to allow for much better eye sight.

properties.name: Chinook Salmon
properties.description: Salmon are unique for their ability to move from both fresh and salt water. The Chinook Salmon is one leg up on all the rest of the members in its species, because it lives longer than any other Salomon.  Living up to 10 years old and weighing as much as 50lbs. the Chinook Salmon is truly the heavy weight in trans river-ocean species.    The cause for this species of Salmons extended life span is their size. In a world where the only difference of eating or being eaten is mass then the Chinook Salmon truly has most of its competition beat. Also, the Chinook Salmon generally spend an entire year in a fresh water habitat, unlike its cousins who move directly to sea after birth, before moving out to sea, giving it time to bulk up and prepare for survival.

properties.name: Great-Blue Heron
properties.description: The Great-Blue heron survives on a 100% fish diet. While it will eat amphibians in times where there is an extreme decrease in the food source.    The Great-Blue Heron has two very special adaptations. Its legs are long and slender allowing it to wade in water up to 17 inches deep. The second adaptation of this bird is the beak, which is very long and slender, allowing the bird to spear fish and then eat them on land.

properties.name: Switch Grass
properties.description: Switchgrass grows mostly along fresh water costal areas. It offers cover for animals such as otters, rabbits, and other small mammals. This plant is extremely important because of its ability to hold soil together, keeping the riverbanks where it goes held in place and at the same time catching sediment. The adaptations that allow the switchgrass to provide these tributes to the ecosystem is a full, thick and intricate root system. Extending up to 7 feet into the ground the roots of switchgrass enable the plant to survive hurricane force wind and loss only the feather like leaves on its narrow branches.

properties.name: Common Reed
properties.description: I selected the common reed for many of the same reasons that where behind my selection of the switchgrass, in the light that it provides both cover over an extended area and its root system provides soil structure.  These reed marshes will often times collest many of  the wastes that are carried into them, and flowing out the other side is filtered water and biomass sediments.    Though the reed does have one very distintive differance, the fact that unlike switchgrass, the reed plant will grow in congrigations up to a square km. As the reed lives it sucks water into its hollow stems, in the proccess of doing this the reed acts as a natural filter, defusing wastes both soild and chemical from the water.

properties.name: Black Grass
properties.description: Black Grass grows along side both the common reed and switch grass. This adds to the coverage all three plants are able to provide. Black Grass will grow along the estuarial tide line, holding in place some of the soil during high tide.    Black Grass has a deep root system that allows it to  take hold deep into the lower layers of the soil structure and spread. given the roots fibrous structure the black grass' roots are tightly packed and extremely stiff.

properties.name: Salt Marsh Cordgrass
properties.description: Cord grass, though relatively useless in the latter months of the year provides a food source in the spring. In May and June Cord grass sprouts a flower at the ends of its skinny braches and the seeds in these flowers attract both herbivores and omnivores alike. The abundance of the Cord grass combined with the flowers provide ample nutrition and allows the plant to regerminate as a new again next spring.    A thightly packed root system coupled with a thick stem makes Cord grass extremly durable. Having also the abilaty to reproduces itself in high quanities allows the Salt marsh Cordgrass to be a very helpful plant to the biome.

properties.name: Spike Grass
properties.description: Spike grass is a triple threat, it provide food, shelter and is a natural filter for polluted run-off. As a marsh grass, it is a superb filter for most of the pollutants found in run-off from tributary rivers and streams. It also sprouts a flower in May and June, giving another source of food to the dense population of animals. finally the height of the grass give cover to small mammals and amphibians from airborne predators.    The grass' ability to populate bare marsh, its tolerance to high salinity levels and its thick root system make Spike grass a habitat stabilizer. If Spike grass is destroyed as a result of human activity then the entire habitat falls with it.

properties.name: Southern Bald Eagle(endangered)
properties.description: The Southern Bald Eagle is a magnificent Bird of Prey. With the ability to seek a diverse range of food sources, the bald eagle is one of the most versatile birds. What makes the Southern Bald Eagle estrange from its cousins in the north and in the west is that it is attracted to mainly estuarial areas. The Southern Bald Eagle has adapted its hunting techniques to accommodate the Bays, Harbors and Rivers that make up an estuary.   This particular species of Bald Eagle has a couple of very special adaptations that allow it to survive in an estuarial environment. First, the Southern Bald Eagle’s talons are 3 to 4 inches longer than any of its respective cousins allowing it to catch fish that are both bigger and deeper. Also, the beak of this bird is slightly more curved than other Bald Eagles. Finally, because of the generally stable climate of the south, the Southern Bald Eagle will not reduce activities for any particular season, instead it devotes 100% time looking for food so that it can survive.

properties.name: Stalked Jellyfish
properties.description: Another endangered species in this biome is the Stalked Jellyfish. The Stalked Jellyfish attaches itself to ellgrass and other medium water grass to wait for prey to swim through. The jelly's tentacles are lined with stinging cell and can grow to be several feet in length. The jelly is mostly brown in color to better blend with the grass and to hide from predators.    Due to its need of attaching itself to ellgrass and other species of seaweed to survive, the stalked jellyfish has become indangered because of hurbanization is extending the beaches, thus covering a good portion of subaqueous grasses.

properties.name: Stripped Bass
properties.description: The stripped bass is a hearty fish that moves from both fresh and salt water portions of an estuary. It has a wide caudal and dorsal fin giving it great mobility and power in the water. It is blue on the top and shades to green on the bottom. Its diet consists of anything that it can fit in its mouth and be digested. It is also the State (salt water) fish of NY. The animal keystone species for the Mississippi bay estuary is the stripped bass. Its health and population directly correlate to the overall health and wellness of the biome. The temperature and quality of the water, area of habitat that is available, and the presence of a food source are all factors that will affect the stripped bass. In a case where the all of these factors are in a relatively good state of being, then the Bass will thrive, indicating that the biome itself is in good order. However, if the biome is failling then you will see a dramatic change in the health and population of the Bass.

properties.name: Background Info.
properties.description:
Other than subaqeuos soil being very fertile and that it is used in
many organic fertilizers, I can not find an instance in which case an
where food in being grown in an estuary. With that being said, I am
sure that there is one instance that a person has used an estuary as
site for some sort of hydroponic growing operation.    Tourism
is the second biggest lucrative business in an estuarine bay. Tourism
in estuaries generates ten of billions of dollars, in one instance of
an estuaries revenue, the community made over 1.5 billion dollars in
tourism and beach going alone. Beaches are the main tourist attraction
for an estuary, but 80-90% of the recreational fish catch is done in an
estuary.

properties.name: Landforms
properties.description: The terrain of a typical estuary is, as a river flows towards a body of salt water, the water slows, giving the opportunity for plants to grow along the now slower moving banks. Gradually the river widens and becomes more of a marsh on the edges. As the water flows through these marshes, it is filtered and cleaned. After the water passes this area of the biome it enters a bay, which is more widely know to be the estuary than the latter parts described. Here the sediments carried by the river settle, forming subaqueous soil deposits. The subaqueous soil deposits described above are one of two natural resources consumed humans in this biome, as it is extremely fertile. The other natural resource harvested from this biome is fish, an estimated 1.86 billion dollars of fish are harvested from estuaries in the United States alone. That equates to $6.07 of fish bought by each person in the United States every year.

properties.name: Human Interaction
properties.description:
Other than subaqeuos soil being very fertile and that it is used in
many organic fertilizers, I can not find an instance in which case an
where food in being grown in an estuary. With that being said, I am
sure that there is one instance that a person has used an estuary as
site for some sort of hydroponic growing operation.    Tourism
is the second biggest lucrative business in an estuarine bay. Tourism
in estuaries generates ten of billions of dollars, in one instance of
an estuaries revenue, the community made over 1.5 billion dollars in
tourism and beach going alone. Beaches are the main tourist attraction
for an estuary, but 80-90% of the recreational fish catch is done in an
estuary.    Estuaries are of the up most importance in terms of
conservation. Other than its vitality to the economy, estuaries are, I
believe, a keystone biome. If an estuary fails then the state of the
biomes around it begin to deteriorate. The esruary provides a major
food source for a great deal of animals, these animals not only are in
the estuarine biome, but in others surounding it as well. Also, fish
and othe marine animals use it as a safe haven, where they can hunt,
sleep and respawn.

properties.name: Bacteria
properties.description: The bacteria in this biome plays an important role. They can convert toxic chemicals released by the vent into food and energy. The bacteria is all chemosynthetic. They all have different chemicals as a part of their metabolism. The bacteria are either consumed by the organism or they are harbored in their bodies. This is done so Microbes can produce food for them. An interesting fact is that scientists have found that the bacteria in these vents have enzymes that can stand high pressure and temperature. These qualities give them many uses for industry. Some bacteria can take bad chemicals and make them good. This would be useful for cleaning up oil spills and hazardous wastes.

properties.name: Landforms
properties.description: The vent itself would be considered a landform because it is an underwater geyser. the place where the water and chemicals come out is also called a chimney. This is because the chemicals that fall out of the water build up around the opening forming a chimney.

properties.name: Tourist and Such
properties.description: Some agricultural things in this biome would be the minerals. They are copper, zinc, iron, and sulfur. However, they do not get taken out because of the depth of the biome. There are also no tourist attractions also due to the depth of the vent. The biome itself would probably be conserved on its own because people cannot get down to it. Therefore it is basically protected.The scientists use a machine named Alvin to do research on the hydrothermal vents. Alvin is a submersible (small submarine). It is aoperated by the Woods Hole Oceanographic Institute. In 1977 Alvin dove 8,000 feet and discovered the very first hydrothermal vent seen by humans. It was located on the East Pacific Rise near the Galapagos Islands.

properties.name: Endangered/Extinct
properties.description: Mollusks are filter feeders, algae, plant, fungus grazers, active hunters, parasites, and scavengers. They can breathe either air or water. They live in carbon based ecosystems or clustered around hydrothermal vents.Mollusks can be found clustered around the silicon rich, warm, water of the hydrothermal vents. The reason they are endangered is because humans are threatening their habitats. Humans also are threatening their food supplies and the purity of the water that they breathe. An example of the endangered mollusk is the Nautilius Pompilius.

properties.name: Keystone Species
properties.description: The keystone species of the hydrothermal vent biome is the tubeworm. It houses many bacteria. It has no mouth or gut. The tubeworm bacteria can take bad chemicals and turn them into good chemicals. This process helps with the other animals in the biome because they can get the bacteria they need from the tubeworm.

properties.name: How it works # 1
properties.description: The earths crustal plates seperate, this causes the ocean floor to crack. cold seawater goes down into the cracks

properties.name: how it works #2
properties.description: The water that goes down into the cracks is heated in the mantle by molten rock. When the water is heating there are chemical reactions going on. the minerals oxygen, magnesium, potassium, and others are removed from the water.

properties.name: How it works #3
properties.description: The further down the water goes the hotter it will get. dissolving into the water from the crust are copper, zinc, iron, and sulfur. this greatly heated mixture with all those metals in rises/

properties.name: How it works #4
properties.description: when this mixture comes out of the ocean floor there are more chemical reactions because of the cold and full of oxygen water. This causes hydrogen sulfide (a compound toxic to most organisms) to form. Minerals then "rain out" of the mix. Those minerals build the vent chimneys.

properties.name: How it works #5
properties.description: Vent chimneys are also called black smokers. the temperature coming out of the vents are around 360 degrees celcius and are filled with metals. they are mostly iron and sulfur. those combine and form black minerals known as metal sufides. that is where the water from the vent gets its black color.Some are called white smokers. these ones are smaller, cooler and release the water slower than the black smokers. this water has the compunds barium, calcium, and silicon, which are white.

properties.name: Tubeworm
properties.description: characteristicsThe tubeworm is the keystone species of the hydrothermal vent. It has no mouth, or stomach. They also have no eyes. It depends on on bacteria to survive.adaptationsThey do rely on symbiotic bacteria that live in their bodies to metabolize the sulphurous volcanic soup in which they both survive. The tubeworm originally starts out with a mouth and stomach but as it grows the dissapear.

properties.name: Vent Clam
properties.description: characteristicsThe vent clam is well known for its symbiotic relationship with the bacteria in the gills. Clam beds are frequented by predators like the spider crab. It has a rich bacterial population associated with its gills.adaptationsIt move actively, and uses a large fleshy foot that pushes out from between its shells to anchor the clam into a crevice or pull it along to a new loccation. Its relatives move this way to search for food. However, the vent clam is searching for the best conditions to grow gill bacteria. It is totally dependent on bacterial garden for its food and lost all trace of its gut.

properties.name: Vent Crab
properties.description: characteristicsThe vent crab is a top predator at the vent sites. As it grows it changes from red to white and grows from less that 1 inch long to about 5 inches long.adaptationsThey are present in such high densities that scientists use them as an indicator that they are arriving at a vent. They were found among dense clusters of tubeworms at average depths of 1.7 miles and can tolerate temperatures averaging between 77 degrees F and 36 degrees F. These are temperatures surrounding the vents.

properties.name: Pompeii Worm
properties.description: characteristics The pompeii worm can only survive in an environment with heat temperatures up to 176 degrees F.adaptations It puts its butt, (rear end), in water up to 176 degrees F. Then at the same time puts its head in water at 70 degrees F. Also helping with the heat is a bacterial fleece covering its back.   http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pompeii_worm

properties.name: Sea Spider
properties.description: characteristics They are major predators at axial vents. They are common on the tops of fringes of vents. The females brood eggs. The males are wider than females and are agressive towards each other.adaptations They can be found on rocks and dock pilings, around hydroids, and bryazooms. They are carnivores. They eat/feed on hydroids, soft corals, anemones, bryazooms, small polychalls, sponges, and sometimes algea.

properties.name: background/climate
properties.description: They hydrothermal vent biome is found in the deep ocean. They are also called black smokers due to the reaction of chemicals coming out of the vent. The temperature in the deep ocean water is around 2 degrees C (356 degrees F). Coming directly off the vent the temperature is around 350 degrees C (662 degrees F).They are formed in the ocean where to oceanic plates pull apart. Then lava erupts replacing the sea floor.

properties.name: Human uses
properties.description: There are many minerals such as copper, zinc, and sulfur in the hydrothermal vents. However, the vents are to deep for humans to get the minerals out of. If they would take the minerals out of the vents, the vent itself would fall.

properties.name: Beaver
properties.description: - The Europeans beaver (castor fiber) is an aquatic mammal. Its large, paddle-like tail helps it swim and slap down on the water when danger has arisen. This is one of its defenses towards predators. It also has webbed feet to help it swim. But it is mainly known for its dam building traits. It uses its extremely strong front teeth to do this.I have chosen this animal to be my keystone species because of the impact it creates on the total ecosystem. It builds dams to control the water flow, in turn keeping the water level under control. If you walk to the nearest creek, river, or stream, there is a good chance that the level the water is at right now has something to do with a beaver dam up stream. Without the beaver, the water would find a new path, but not before destroying everything in its path first.

properties.name: Ibex
properties.description: The ibex is a wild goat that lives in the European Alps. It has huge horns that are curved back and ridged. It is considered a master grazer and that is why it was chosen as one of my top five. When looked at as the "white-tailed deer" of this area, it was an easy choice.Ibex live in mountainous areas where it is hard for predators to get at them. In turn, they have extreme mountain climbing skills. The ibex has small feet, which allow it to dig into the mountainside and attain traction. It is also a herbivore. Which is important because, although it is very capable of killing anything it likes, it only eats plants.

properties.name: Pileated Woodpecker
properties.description: The pileated woodpecker is a medium sized black colored bird with a red tassel on the crest of its head. The territories of this magnificent bird are believed to reach 200 acres, but the same time each year they return to the same tree with there mate. This is one of those cool things that nature did. They make holes in trees for there nesting grounds called cavities. They eat the insects in trees and on the ground in the area they feed. On occasion, you may see one at a bird feeder.Pileated Woodpeckers have the adaptation of boring holes in trees about 3 inches wide and 12-24 inches deep. Mainly insectivorous, when the insects are scarce it has the adaptation of eating plants and vegetables as well. The reason i picked this animal to be one of my five is that its niche is a very important. It is seen that the pileated woodpecker makes homes for other animals in trees. Because of its home making skills, I chose it.

properties.name: Musk Ox
properties.description: The musk ox is a very large mammal that is more fur than anything else. It is closer related to the wild goat or sheep than an oxen, but its name stands. It feeds of the natural grasses of the grasslands and also eats the lichens.Probably the most recognizable adaptation that meets the eye is the massive animals outer coat. It has developed this to stay warm in the cold grasslands of the European. The fine under-wool is what keeps the musk ox so warm. Another interesting adaptation the musk ox has acquired is the horns. Its there only form of protection not only for them, but for there calves as well. Both male and female musk ox have them and when being attacked by wolves, or any hungry predator, they circle their calves with their horns outward and stand their ground.

properties.name: Wolf
properties.description: The European wolf is a large sized predatory dog. Its hair is shorter than the American wolf and denser. They eat mainly meat, large in size. Such as livestock, musk ox, and other large animals. They are one of the animals at the top of the food chain.Some adaptations of the wolf are its hunting skills. Over time, they have perfected it to a science. They are the best at what they do, which is why they are at the top of the food chain. Also, there fur has changed to fit the area they live.

properties.name: Lynx
properties.description: The lynx is an animal that lives in the deciduous forest of Europe. It is a medium sized predatory cat that hunts and consumes rodents and other small mammals. It is a nocturnal hunter, meaning that it normally hunts at night. The jaws of the lynx are very powerful and have pointed teeth.The reason it is endangered are many. Some of the reasons are that it was once trapped for its fur and sold. Because of this, the population of this animal dwindled for many years. Other predators took over and now are main competition for the prey. Therefore, the lynx is endangered.

properties.name: Climate
properties.description: The climate in this area is the same as our area. They have four seasons with growing seasons in-between. The annual rainfall is between 50cm and 70cm, mostly falling in spring and summer. It snows for around 3 months in the winter, but the annual snowfall is not very high.

properties.name: Landforms
properties.description: The landforms in the European grasslands and deciduous forest are just that. In the northern parts of this area in Europe, are the grasslands. Long plains somewhat like what we are used to seeing here, with tall grasses and rolling hills. In the more southern parts, there are the well-known European Alps. In this area, the mountains run 500 miles long and 100 miles wide. The highest peak is Mount Blanc at 15,771 feet. The human use of this area mainly is narrowed to tree harvesting. Land clearing, for the commercial use for of trees, is common in the deciduous forests of Europe.

properties.name: Agriculture/Tourism
properties.description: One of the major agricultural grains grown here is wheat. It is the most common planted, harvested plant in the area. The main tourism in this area consists of national parks and reservations. It is popular for the national parks to clear-cut the land they own and make farmlands out of it. There are some reservations that try to keep the forest, but more cut it away.

properties.name: Common Lime
properties.description: The common lime is a tall, stately tree that grows in the forests of Europe. In this area, it is the tallest, broad-leaved tree in Britain. It has been seen that the common lime tree can live to be 500 years old. I have chosen it because of the plentiful fruit it makes for the animals that live off it. Not only the animals that eat its fruit, but it also needs bees to pollinate it. So it needs the animals and the animals need the common lime.The adaptations of the common lime are mostly the same as all the other plants. This is because they all live in the same biome, and they have to have the same adaptations to live here. Some of these include a wide and shallow root system, and a heart shaped leaf. Both of these adaptations are needed for survival.

properties.name: Norway Maple
properties.description: The Norway maple is a medium sized tree. It is noted for its milky sap in the leaf stalk and its five lobed leaves. Its leaves change color in the fall and there are buds that grow on the ends of the twigs in the spring. The trees bark gets darker as the tree gets older. I chose this tree because it is native to this area and sustains the life in this biome.Some unique adaptations of the Norway maple is its milky sap. Its not just a characteristic, but an adaptation because when a branch is broken off, it seeps from the wound and creates a scab like covering. There are other adaptations as well, but they are the same as the rest of the plants.

properties.name: Lichens
properties.description: Lichens are composite organism containing symbiotic associations with fungus. There are many different types of lichens but to make it simple, it’s a fungus that grows on the ground, on rock and trees, pretty much everywhere. I chose this plant because it is a food source for almost all herbivorous animals.Some adaptations of lichens are its ability to grow anywhere and everywhere. Its rooting system is different in the sense that it can grow on surfaces without dirt or any nutritional benefiting substances. It is a very wild growing plant. Animals need it to survive and it needs the animals to keep it “groomed”

properties.name: Lady Fern
properties.description: The lady fern is semi common in our area, only because we also live in the deciduous forest region. The lady fern stands 2-3 feet tall and has long, stretched out leaves. You can see them in open meadows and clearings. They grow naturally but many people like to use them to decorate there houses and landscapes.Some adaptations of the lady fern are its root pattern. It is very widespread. This is because it is used to keep soil in place. If you see a lady fern growing alongside a creek, it has adapted to this area and holds the eroding soil in its place.

properties.name: Oak Tree
properties.description: The oak tree is a universal term for over 400 species of oak trees. There leaves are spirally shaped with lobed margins; some species have completely lobed leaves. Another characteristic is the fruit called an acorn. It develops in the spring and matures during the summer months, then falls off in the fall which helps repopulate its kind. I chose this tree because without its fruit for animals to eat, any animals may become extinct. Also because it is a main plant in this area.Some adaptations of the common oak are that of its root system. It is one of the widest in the forest. This is useful to collect the rainfall and keep the tree upright in some of the windy conditions of this area. Another, are the acorns. If the tree would not reproduce, then it would not ever survive.

properties.name: Harvest Mouse
properties.description: The harvest mouse is a very small rodent. Its fur is reddish-yellow on the top and white underneath. It eats grains and foods of the seed group, sometimes insects also. They gather food day and night. They weigh only a quarter of an ounce, which lets them nimbly climb up the stems of the wheat grass.The primary reason for this animal becoming endangered is habitat loss. The upper edges of the wetlands, where they live, are filling in with water. Since they have nowhere else to go, its predators are plucking them off easily. This is why they are now endangered.

properties.name: Background Information
properties.description: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Swiss_alps

properties.name: Swiss Alps
Logging Conservations
properties.description: http://www.bls.gov/oco/ocos178.htm

properties.name: Logging
Other animals I considered
properties.description: A choice I almost made was the European Red Squirrel. It had a major impact on the forest through the food it stores and eats. The food it eats makes trees via buried nuts and seeds. This was a close sixth choice.

properties.name: Prairie Dog
properties.description: The Prairie Dogs are very important animals in the biome.  They are on average about 14-17 inches when they stand up.  Their lifespan is from about 3-5 years.  The prairie dogs sleep during the day and they are very active during the early morning and evening.The prairie dog is very important the the other animals in the biome too because they help about 170 other speceis in the biome.  They are plant eaters and will not eat anymeat at all.  They are also very easy prey for the other animals http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Prairie.dog.600pix.jpg

properties.name: Buffalo
properties.description: The buffalo is a very important to the grassland biome. They eat a lot of the grass so that the grass doesn't grow too high in the. The buffalo travel in herds of 10 to 50. The buffalo is another name for the American Bison. They weigh anywhere from 800 pounds to 1,000 pounds. In the early 1800's people thought that the bison were extinct.http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:American_bison_k5680-1.jpg

properties.name: Ladybug
properties.description: The ladybug is very important to the biome.  One of the reasons is because there are  lot of farmers in the area and they eat all the little bug that eat plants.  The ladybugs are also easy prey for the other animals that are bigger.  Some of the farmers depend on their crops to live and the ladybugs help.  They actually dump the ladybugs in the fields to help the crops grow better

properties.name: Elk
properties.description: The elk are very important to the biome.  One of the reasons is because they travel in herds and keep the grass under control.  The baby calf animals are  also good prey for the coyotes and other meat eating animals. The elk mostly just eat the grass and plants.  These animals were once very extinct and now they moved them all over the world  and their population has gone back up again.  They are now hunted in the western part of the state.

properties.name: Coyote
properties.description: The coyote is one of the most important animals in the biome.  They hep contol the population by getting all the little animals and eating them for their pups.  They have about 6-12 pup per litter and only about half will make it past a month.  They eat any kind of little animals.  They grow to be about 4 feet long.  They are about 2 feet tall off of the ground when they are on all 4 legs

properties.name: Big Bluestem Grass
properties.description: This plant is very important in this biome.  Another name for this plant is Turkey Feet because of the shape of the seed heads.  It blooms from June through September.    Some adaptations of this plant is that it is 3 to 10 feet tall.  This type of grass is an important food for the American bison because it is the biggest type of grass that there is.  When farmers plow this plant there is nothing to keep the dirt from blowing away and this is part of the reason the dust bowl happened in the 1930’s

properties.name: Blue Grama Grass
properties.description: The nest plant is Blue Grama Grass and it is also very important plant in this biome.  This plant makes up 75% to 90% of the grasses found in the biome.  This grass is anywhere from 6 to 12 inches high.      When this plant is plowed it could take up to 50 years to grow back.  This plant is another reason that the dust bowl happened.  This plant can stand the heat, drought , and cold but it doesn’t like the shade.  Some people use this instead of regular grass because it helps prevent erosion and it is also really good for grazing animals.

properties.name: Buffalo Grass
properties.description: Buffalo grass is very important in this biome. This plant grows in all most every grassland biome all over the world.  This grass in small it only grows between 2 and 5 inches.    This grass is used to make some fake grass or turf.  This plant can catch on fire easy and it can help the biome because if it catches fire it will grow new plants for the animals too eat.  This is also a very good plant for bison traveling in heads because there is a lot of this grass and they can eat it while traveling.

properties.name: Indian Grass
properties.description: This plant is very important in this biome. It is know as a warm season grass. It will start in May and grow till July or August. This plant will grow from 5 to 12 inches high and ½ inches wide. This grass is grown in the grasslands but it can also be found in Europe and Africa. This grass is great for grazing meadows when its young.

properties.name: Stinging Nettle
properties.description: This plant is also very important in this biome. It can sting you if you touch it with your bare skin. It can grow up to 2 to 4 feet.

properties.name: Keystone Species
properties.description: Keystone species The keystone species in the grasslands would be the prairie dog. These animals are very difficult to breed. About five years ago people started to keep them as pets and they are very hard to take care of and they weren’t getting the right care and were dying. They are a very important prey for the black footed ferret, the swift fox, golden eagle, and the badger. All these animals that it is most important to ate endangered. There are many more animals that in is important to but those are the main ones. So now you should be able to see why many people say that this animal is a keystone species.

properties.name: Background Info
properties.description: Background info This biome is a mostly flat biome with a lot of grass and some colorful flowers. Another name for this biome is the prairie. In the whole world if you add up all the grasslands there will be about 1.4 million square miles. This biome has adapted very well to wild fires. The fires are a good thing because it lets the plants grow back and the animals like them when they are just starting to grow. This biome is in bad shape and we need to help it as much as we possibly can.

properties.name: landforms
properties.description: There aren’t too many landforms in this biome because it is so flat but there are some so we will name them. There are many lakes and wetlands in this biome. There are also many rivers in this biome. The rivers flow off of the mountains in the Rockies and eventually get too the grasslands. They don’t get much rain in the biome and It is always dry so they have some fires. And they also have some tornadoes because it is so flat.

properties.name: Human Activity
properties.description: From the 1930’s until 10 years farmers have made up 50% of the population. But now it has dropped to 10% and that is a major problem. With not as many farmers plowing and some people are worried that there might be another dust bowl. There is a variety of crops grown in the biome. And many people aren’t farming because of the economic struggle they are moving into the city. Also there are some fuels that we could get from the grasslands but we don’t drill for them.

properties.name: Tourist Attractions
properties.description: If you like the old western movies and are interested in that kind of stuff then this area is the perfect area for you to visit. North Dakota is one of the oldest western tourist states. If you’re a farmer and want to go out west you would want too go to Iowa. They are know as the corn state producing over $10 million in crops and livestock yearly. If you want to go out west and are interested in the civil war then Kansas is a good place for you to visit. They also have the worlds largest ball of twine in Cawker City. If you would like to see the Oregon trail Nebraska would be a good place for you to visit. And if your into art they have one of the largest are museums in the world.

properties.name: Agriculture
properties.description: There is a lot of agriculture in this biome. There is a lot of farmlands in this biome that grow many different crops like corn and other crops. The grassland is very important to this country because of all the crops and animals that they grow and raise. There are many cultivated forage crops in this biome. There is also the most square pasture miles in this biome than any other biome in the world. Many of the pastures in the biome aren’t owned by one person they are owned by the state.

properties.name: Northern Swift Fox
properties.description: Northern Swift Fox The Northern Swift Fox has been hanging on by a little bit for many years now but they are getting worse. They have been being illegally killed by hunters and farmers so they are getting worse. Their diet consists of small mammals, insects, and grass. The northern swift fox has been around for a while now and would be greatly missed if they go extinct. They are the smallest fox that we know of. They usually have about 5 pups per liter and not all of them survive most of the time.

properties.name: Black Footed Ferret
properties.description: These animals are very rare and it’s hard to tell how many of them there are because they come out at night and we can’t get an exact number of how many there are. They are members of the weasel family. Their diet consists of prairie dogs and another cool thing about these animals is that they live in the burrows of their prey. They are predators too the smaller animals.

properties.name: Bald Eagle
properties.description: The first animal that I picked was the Bald Eagle. The Eagle is one of the most beautiful animals in the world. And just think that animal is going extinct. These animals are a big help for the economy and the world. They keep some of the rodent population down. And they also take good care of the land that they live on. This animal is easy to see and describe. They are large with a white head and a black body .How they keep down the rodent population is that they fly around and they capture there food that way. There food chain is very simple. They eat fish mammals smaller birds and sometimes carrion. There nest is used more then one time due to disturbances. There nest can weight about 2 tons. They can be as small as 0.16 square Km. and as big as 12.69 square Km. They nest in very high trees.

properties.name: Western Tanger
properties.description: The next creature that i am going to talk about is the Western Tanger. They are about 6-7 inches in length, they have bright red heads, and bright yellow body, jet black wings.They eat fruit, and insects it forges for food in the trees and shrubery. They live in the open part of the Coniferious Forest. They also breed in they open parts of the forest and mixed deciduous-coniferous forests. In the winteropen mntain pine woodland and in the parks and gardens.In my own oppenion I think that they could live in another place also, because they can get fruit and inscects and they could have that all. They would just have to stay hidden from the bigger animals and they will do good in differemt parts of the other forests. They could adapt to the surroundings and be able to eat the fruits in that area.

properties.name: Rocky Mountain Big horn Sheep.
properties.description: Then for my last animal that I am going to do is the Rocky Mountain Big Horned Sheep.They have very uniqe characteristics. They have dramatically curved horns.Short brown hair and in a range pale tan to dark brown. They have a white patch on there rumps and a contrasting short dark brown tale. They eat grass sedes, and forbs.They live between the rocky slopesof a moutain and the open meadows.They could possibly live in an other place. But the only problem would be they live in the rocky mountains and the planes. They could have problems but not with food,because they eat grass.

properties.name: Evergreen Everlasting
properties.description: The first plant that I choose was the Evergreen Everlasting. The reason why they are going extinct is that people are cutting down the trees just to make roads and they are not caring. The trees provide oxygen into the atmosphere and is a big helper of the o-zone layer of the atmosphere.They prefer to have there habitat be in the Serpentine Rock fields and grasslands. The reason why you can find them there is that they can grow on that type of land and not have a problem doing so. They are probobly the only tree that can grow on that type of land.

properties.name: Koehler's Stripitate
properties.description: The Koehler's Stripitate is the next plant that I chose. The reason why I picked it is that this plant is endangered and is not doing so good. People are cutting down these trees to build homes.There preferred habitat is in the Jeffery pine/grasslands. And they also like the open serpentine. They probably like open field better then they like closed in places.

properties.name: Maidenhair Spleenwort
properties.description: The next plaint that i am going to pick is the Maidenhair Spleen wort. They are going extinct because people are destroying them. The tree is being destroyed or they are going extinct.They perfurer to be in the lower montane. They also are found in the coniferous forest. And they are also in the rocky out corps.

properties.name: McDonald's Rock Cress
properties.description: The plant that I am going o tell you about is the McDonald's Rock Cress. They live in the coniferiuos forest. They are in danger and or going extinct.They perfer to be with other trees like the Jeffery pine tree. Or the grassland trees. Or even the serpentine trees.

properties.name: Douglas Fir
properties.description: The last tree that I am going to do is the Douglas Fir. They grow up to 40-60 feet high. The trunk is usually 12-2 feet in diameter.This tree is a shiny tree. Its needles don't fall off so easily. And when you rub it is smells of camphor.

properties.name: Pileated Woodpecker
properties.description: The Keystone species. The main keystone species is the Pileated Woodpecker. It is the largest woodpecker in the region.

properties.name: wood duck
properties.description: A keystone species is an organism that has a significant influence on the ecosystem. Keystone habitat modifiers are also called "ecosystem engineers." The pileated woodpecker is a keystone habitat modifier in the northwest. There is a list of animals that can be the keystone species. The one that i am going to list is the wood duck.

properties.name: bufflehead
properties.description: A keystone species is an organism that has a significant influence on the ecosystem. Keystone habitat modifiers are also called "ecosystem engineers." The pileated woodpecker is a keystone habitat modifier in the northwest. There is a list of animals that can be the keystone species

properties.name: Brown Creeper
properties.description: A keystone species is an organism that has a significant influence on the ecosystem. Keystone habitat modifiers are also called "ecosystem engineers." The pileated woodpecker is a keystone habitat modifier in the northwest. There is a list of animals that can be the keystone species

properties.name: Bushy Tailed Woodrat
properties.description: A keystone species is an organism that has a significant influence on the ecosystem. Keystone habitat modifiers are also called "ecosystem engineers." The pileated woodpecker is a keystone habitat modifier in the northwest. There is a list of animals that can be the keystone species.

properties.name: Piranha
