properties.description: The first animal I Chose is the Piranha, I chose the piranha because they have many important characteristics. Piranhas are omnivores they eat plants when there is no meat around any other time they eat meat, if there is no meat or plants the piranhas will eat others from there group. The species that hunt Piranhas are Caiman, River dolphins, and gigantic arapaima    The Piranha can adapt to their surroundings and can live in a lot more places then just the rainforest. Although for a piranha to survive in other surrounding it would need to have certain types of weeds they feed on. The piranhas have blade shaped lobes on its tail which help it swim faster toward its prey, they also have thick scales on their heads to protect them when they butt against the carcass while feeding on it.

properties.name: Morpho Butterfly
properties.description: The second animal I chose is a Morpho Butterfly, I chose the morpho butterfly because they are important to the habitat because, morpho butterflies are herbivores. They have to drink all of their foods so they mainly drink the juices from rotting fruit, fluids of decomposing animals, tree sap and wet mud. The species that hunt morpho butterflies are the Jacamar, Jaguars, and Bengal Tigers.    The morpho butterfly cannot live n more places then just the rainforest. For a morpho butterfly to survive it would need all of the food in which it eats. They have a mouthpart called a proboscis, which allows them to drink all of the juices they need. They have poisons inside of them, which affect the predators that hunt them. They have camouflage, which allows them to blend into the trees at night so that they wont get eaten.

properties.name: Agouti
properties.description: The last animal I chose is the Agouti, it is a crucial animal because, they are the only animals with teeth strong enough to open Brazilian nuts. They scatter the seeds throughout the rain forest away from the parent tree and bury them. These seeds germinate and form the next generation of trees.The agouti can only live in the rain forest. The agouti eats mainly fruit that have fallen from trees and nuts. The animals that eat the agouti are Jaguars, coatimundis, and ocelots. The agouti, gather food in groups sometimes up to 100.

properties.name: Jaguar
properties.description: The third animal I chose is a Jaguar, I chose the jaguar because they are very important to the habitat. The jaguars are hunters that use stealth, which allows them to stay hidden while hunting. They can hunt almost anywhere because they are very fast swimmers which is useful while chasing down prey.    The Jaguar can live in more places than just the rainforest. Jaguars eat almost any kind of animal they mainly hunt almost any kind of deer, fish, wild boars, iguanas, turtles, capybaras, and most rodents. The jaguar is at the top of the food chain which means that nothing hunts them they just hunt other animals.

properties.name: Bengal Tiger
properties.description: The fourth animal I chose is the Bengal Tiger, I chose the Bengal tiger because they have many important characteristics such as. The Bengal tiger is an indicator species, which means that it shows the overall health and quality of the ecosystem. The way that they do this is, if the tigers are doing well it means that the ecosystem. Is doing well. They do this because the Bengal Tiger needs certain conditions for it to live and if it doesn’t get them they will die out so the ecosystem has to stay in tact for it to stay healthy. Without the Bengal Tiger deer and boar become overpopulated. The Bengal Tiger can live in more places then just the rainforest. Bengal tigers mainly consume wild boar, deer, moose, hares, rabbits, pikas, and fish. The Bengal tiger is at the top of the food chain which means that nothing hunts them they only hunt other animals

properties.name: Bromeliads
properties.description: The first plant that I’ve chosen is the bromeliads. The reason that I chose the bromeliad is that they hare homes to many animals in the rainforest such as frogs, tadpoles, salamanders, snails, beetles, and mosquito larvae. The center of these is for catching rainwater. They can hold up to several gallons of water.    Inside of one bromeliad plant it was home to several small beetles, crane flies, earwigs, a frog, a cockroach, spiders, fly larvae, a millipede, a scorpion, woodlice, and an earthworm. The animals that die decompose and furnish the bromeliad with nutrients.

properties.name: Carnivorous Plants
properties.description: The carnivorous plants can defend it self by consuming small mammals and reptiles that try to steal insects from its pitcher. The pitcher usually is crammed full of digested insects. The third plant that I’ve chosen is the saprophyte plant. The saprophyte is a decomposer plant. This is important because they decomposers break down the organisms, which gives off nutrients into the plants and helps them live. This plant has to compete with rainfall because it constantly washes away the nutrients on the forest floor.

properties.name: saprophyte
properties.description: The third plant that I’ve chosen is the saprophyte plant. The saprophyte is a decomposer plant. This is important because they decomposers break down the organisms, which gives off nutrients into the plants and helps them live. This plant has to compete with rainfall because it constantly washes away the nutrients on the forest floor. The saprophyte works extremely efficient in with the warmth and wetness which helps accelerate decomposition. These plants are usually under trees growing because the soil is moister which helps them grow, they can also grow in animal dropping, and on leaves. Saprophytes are usually so small that they cannot be seen with the naked eye, they are called microbes. The decayed matter they decomposed contains essential nutrients, such as iron, calcium, potassium, and phosphorous.

properties.name: hibiscus
properties.description: The fourth plant that I have chosen is the hibiscus. The reason that I have chosen the hibiscus is that its used for many medicine purposes the Indians thought it to cure many ailments. The Indians also used this plant for hair care purposes.    The hibiscus relies on humming birds to pollinate it. Although, it can pollinate itself. This plant is needed because bees, beetles all rely on this plant to feed on it pollen.

properties.name: Guacatonga
properties.description: The last plant that I have chosen is the Guacatonga. The reason that I have chose this plant is that it is used for medical reasons. The bark of this plant is used to treat diarrhea, chest colds, and the fly. The seeds from this plant are used to treat wounds and leprosy. This can also help treat skin diseases, cancer, stomach ulcers, snakebite and bee stings, herpes, and it is the antiseptic in mouthwash products.    The plant is very important for medical purposes. It prevents skin cancer in animals.  It can grow up to 2-3 meters long. This plant needs a lot of rain for it to survive. Without this plant we would be out of a lot of cures for diseases.

properties.name: Keystone Species
properties.description: The agouti is the species that is the keystone species in the Central American rain forest. They are rodents taht are herbivores they eat fruit that has fallen from trees, and nuts. Agouti are prey to several animals such as Jaguars, Coatimundis, Ocelots and more.

properties.name: Amazon River
properties.description: The Amazon River is the largest river on the earth by volume. The river is 120 miels long. It is the second longest river next to the Nile. The Amazon River contains piranhas, dwarf caimans, anacondas, river turtles, and more.

properties.name: Amazon Basin
properties.description: The Amazon Basin is the first land form it takes up 54% up Brazil this basin is the largest basin in the world. Most of the plants and animals living here are unknown because most of the basin is unexplored. The plant growth is dense here because of the heavy rainfall. There is one popular tropical fruit that grows here called abiu.

properties.name: Andes Mountains
properties.description: The Andes Mountain form the world's largest exposded mountain range, going over 4,400 miles long. The mountain range is formed up of to great ranges called them Cordillera Oriental and the Cordillera Occidental. The Andes go through 7 countries, which are Argentina, Bolivia, Chile, Colombia, Ecuador, Peru, Trinidad, and Venezuela, some of which are known as Andean States.

properties.name: Background information
properties.description: The Central American rain forests get an average from 50 to 260 inches of rainfall each year the humidity is usually between 77 and 88%. The temperature of this biome rarely drops below 68 degrees and rarely gets higher than 93 degrees. The tropical rainforest has more trees than in any other area in the world. Sceintists counted that there was 100-300 different specieis in just 2 1/2 acres, 70% of rain forest plants are trees.The rain forests only cover less than 6% of the earths land surface but scientists eastimate that over half of the world's plnats and animals live in the Rainforest. They also produce 40% of all earths' oxygen. About 1/4 of all the medicines in which we use come from Rainforests  plants.  There are over 1,400 different tropical plants that are thought to be the cure for cancer.

properties.name: Golden lion Tamarind Monkey
properties.description: The golden lion Tamarind monkey is an endangered species in the Central America Rainforest. This monkey lives in the canopies in the Rainforest. The monkey is an omnivore it consumes rainwater to drink and insects inside of bromeliads and other small animals living in the bark of trees, and fruit

properties.name: Poison Dart frog
properties.description: The poison dart frogs lay their eggs inside of Bromeliads because of the water they gather, because of this it provides their tadpoles with unfertilized eggs to eat

properties.name: Ways humans exploited
properties.description: The central American Rainforest is being exploited in many ways. The first way that its exploited is that humans are cutting down the trees to harvest the wood, and for cattle and sheep ranching.Another reason is because we use a lot of the plants they have there for medicinal reasons, like the Guacatonga is part of the cure to treat diarrhea, chest colds, the flu, wounds, leprosy, skin diseases, cancer, stomach ulcers, snakebites, bee stings, and herpes. humans also kill the animals there for their fur

properties.name: Bobcat
properties.description: My first animal for the top 5 is the Bobcat (Felis Rufus) some of its characteristics are that it is the most abundant wildcat in the U.S; it is nocturnal which makes them rarely spotted by humans. They have long legs and large paws and tufted ears.Some of its adaptations are that it can live in many different biomes including the Boreal Forest, Deciduous forest and sometimes the Arctic regions.

properties.name: Red Fox
properties.description: My second animal is the Red Fox (Vulpes Vulpes) some of its characteristics is that it has a thick tail to help aid its balance same as cats, they use there tail to help stay warm in very cold temperature also as a signal to communicate with other foxes. They are solitary hunters and normally feed on small rodents such as rabbits.Some adaptations of the fox is that it’s able to live in many different areas it can live in the regular forest but also it has been known to live in some Arctic areas as well.

properties.name: Wolf
properties.description: My third animal is the Wolf (Canis Lupus) some of its characteristics is that it is the largest member of the dog family they were once found all over the Northern Hemisphere but were soon hunted and almost turned extinct, there are currently an endangered species. Wolves are known for their howl they usually howl to attract the attention of its pack, or to signal food. Wolves hunt in packs of 6 to 10 animals and are known to roam large distances. Some adaptations are that they can survive pretty much anywhere in North America because they have been seen in many forests and also in the Arctic areas.

properties.name: Mountain Lion
properties.description: My fourth animal is the Mountain Lion (Felis Concolor) some of its characteristics are that they are like the wolf once seen all over North America but is now also an endangered species. They usually prey on large animals like deer and sometimes they will eat smaller mammals like rabbits. Some adaptations are that it can survive in forests and also in the mountains. It can hunt by itself and usually does not hunt in packs

properties.name: North American River Otter
properties.description: My fifth animal is the North American River Otter (Lutra Canadensis) some of its characteristics is that there homes are usually a burrow at a waters edge, it can thrive in water some kinds of water it can live in is; rivers, lakes, swamps, and estuary ecosystems. They are excellent swimmers. They have water repellant which keeps them warm and dry. On land these otters can run almost as good as they can swim. They are a member of the weasel family. They normally hunt a night, some of the things they eat include, fish, amphibians, turtles and, crayfish.Some adaptations of he River Otter are they can not only live in water but also land. They can live in many types of water, and sizes. They could also be found in a freshwater biome or possibly a swamp biome.

properties.name: Wild Rice
properties.description: My first plant is the Wild Rice (Zizania Aquatica). The reason I chose this plant is because it is a plant that people and animals can eat for food. Some characteristics are, it has broad blades 50-100cm long and the fruit on it looks like a dark-colored elongated grain 1.3-2cm long. Some adaptations of the wild rice are that it is native to North America it mostly grows in marshes, pond, lakes, and slow moving rivers.

properties.name: Wild Garlic
properties.description: My second plant is the Wild Garlic (Allium Canadense.) The reason I chose this plant is because like the wild rice it can be used as a food source for humans and animals as well. Some characteristics are that it has leaves 15-45cm; its flat and narrow, flowers are pink and whitish.Some of the adaptations are that it was introduced from Europe. It is found in Ontario, Quebec, and New Brunswick. It can mostly be found in low woods, thickets, and meadows.

properties.name: Wild Mint
properties.description: My third plant is the Wild Mint (Mentha Arvensis). The reason I chose this plant is because the leaves can be used for flavoring sauces, jellies, and beverages. Also animals will sometimes eat this. Some characteristics of it are it is and aromatic perennial herb, it grows to be 15-80cm, long leaves that are sharply toothed and strongly aromatic. Flowers are tiny white, light pink, or lavender, bell shaped.Some adaptations are that it is common throughout Eurasia and North America, it is mostly found in moist soil conditions especially along streams.

properties.name: Sweet Grass
properties.description: My fifth plant is the Sweet Grass (Hierochloe Odorata). The reason I chose this plant is because it is a sacred plant of the Native Americans it was used for healing rituals. Some characteristics are that it is a hardy, rhizomatous perennial grass about 60cm. It has sterile shoots, when burned it gives off vanilla scented incense. The long leaves can be used to weave baskets as well.Some adaptations are that is common above 40 degrees north of Asia and North America. Mostly found in wet meadows, low parries, marsh edges, bogs, shaded steam banks, lakeshores, and cool mountain valleys.

properties.name: Mountain Lion
properties.description: My fourth animal is the Mountain Lion (Felis Concolor) some of its characteristics are that they are like the wolf once seen all over North America but is now also an endangered species. They usually prey on large animals like deer and sometimes they will eat smaller mammals like rabbits. Some adaptations are that it can survive in forests and also in the mountains. It can hunt by itself and usually does not hunt in packs

properties.name: Woodland Caribou
properties.description: My first endangered animal is the Woodland Caribou (Rangifer Tarandus Caribou). This animal is small parts of Canada. It is a state and federal endangered animal. The reason this animal is going extinct is because of loss of habitat and too much hunting. It is considered to be one of the most endangered animals in the lower 48 states. The description of the Caribou is its brown, hoofed mammal, large mossy antlers, and a hanging neck mane.Some adaptations of the Caribou are they like to live on the tundra and heavily forested areas. They are an animal that is hunted a lot which is one of the biggest reason it is endangered.

properties.name: Burrowing Owl
properties.description: My second animal is the Burrowing Owl (Athene Cunicularia). This animal is going endangered because of loss of habitat. Some characteristics of this animal are it’s a small ground dwelling animal with a round neck and no ear tufts; they have white eyebrows, yellow eyes, and long legs. They feed mostly on small mammals like mice, rats, gophers, and ground squirrels.Some adaptations of this animal are they are found in open, dry grasslands. They have been reported to roost in loose colonies. These owls are present in North America and they breed across the grassland regions of southern Alberta, Saskatchewan and Manitobaand.

properties.name: Placemark 14
properties.description: The keystone species I will be using for my project is the Siberian Tiger or also known as the Meat Eaters. The reason I chose this was because the definition of a Keystone species is the biggest member or animal of the biome and the Siberian Tiger is the biggest. They are not a prey to anything what so ever but they will prey on just about anything. Some characteristics of this animal are it’s the biggest member of the cat family, it is found in almost all of the Boreal Forest. It feeds on just about anything from fish and rabbits to deer, lynx, and sometimes-even bear.    Some adaptations of this animal is that it can adapt to just about anywhere it has been found in very cold parts of the Boreal forest, and it has also been found in very warm parts of the Boreal Forest. Also it can be found in other biomes such as the rainforest, and maybe even the different types of forests in the world.

properties.name: Background info
properties.description: The biome I am doing is the North American Tundra (Boreal Forest). This biome is pretty much desert besides for a few factory’s and villages there is not many people who live here. This place to me is really messed up because the weather here is always different its not like in Pennsylvania were we have spring, winter, summer, and then fall for a few months each. In the boreal forest it could be freezing cold one day and the next its really warm. But there are some really good things about this biome. It supports many different types of habitat for many different animals and plants. And another cool thing is there are a really big variety of animals all the way from white-tailed deer to Siberian Tigers!    The climate here is always different summers are short and not very warm like even in July the tempeture barely ever rises over 50 degrees the warmest it has ever been is about 70 degrees, and this biome gets a quite a few inches of rain the average yearly precipitation is about 12-33 inches. And in the winter time it gets freezing cold the lowest ever recorded was -65 degrees and the warmest is 30 degrees.

properties.name: Landforms
properties.description: Land Forms    Some of the different types of landforms in the Boreal Forest are forests, valleys, lowlands, hills, mountains, plains, and muskeg. Also you may find large bodies of water.Picture LinksMountains•    http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Picea_glauca_taiga.jpgHuman Activities    Some human activities in the Boreal Forest is Logging this can be good or bad because the more they log the smaller the forest gets, but also it can used to make many different things out of the trees. In Canada less than 80% of the forest is protected and more than 50% has been bought by logging companies to log. The main type of logging is clear cutting where they find an area with a lot of good trees and completely wipe out every single tree. Some of the products made from the trees being logged include toilet paper, copy paper, newsprint, and lumber. More than 80% of the products are exported and sold to the United States. Some of the logging companies there are the Forest Stewardship Council (FSC), Sustainable Forests Initiative (SFI) and the Canadian Standards Association (CSA).

properties.name: tasmaniane tiger
properties.description: the tasmaniane tiger is similar to a dog it almost looks like a wolf as well it has a white stripe on its tale and through its abdomin

properties.name: tasmaniane devil
properties.description: they are nocturnal live only in australia and they are an endangered species.  they live in dry climate and they live in holes they have the strongest bite of all other animals comparisant in size

properties.description: live in dry climate they live in trees and wait for their prey they also eat fruit nuts and insects

properties.name: brown snake
properties.description: live in dry climate they come out in the spring they are found in urban or residential areas they live in vacant parking lots or cemeteries they are dark or grayish brown

properties.name: tarantula
properties.description: live in dry climate live in tube tents made from their silk they live and hunt in the trees have hollow fangs

properties.name: oak tree
properties.description: broad leafed and shed their leaves in one season they live up to 200years old it adapts by getting its soil from the ground

properties.name: willow trees
properties.description: take the water from the ground to stay alive also when it rains the leaves hold water as well we use the willow for building things

properties.name: sunflower
properties.description: can adapt well to dry climate it gets its water from the air they are a food source to animals and humans

properties.name: asteraceae

properties.name: Addax
properties.description: The most distinct feature of the addax has probably got to be its long spiraling horns. It is primarily active at night because of how hot it is during the day. This species of antelope is nearly extinct in the wild, but can still be found on wildlife reservations. We are really the only predator that the addax actually has.   One thing that led to the endangerment of the addax is the fact that its unique horns are highly prized by poachers. Another reason that has led to their decline is the destruction of the pasture fields where they graze. They are also hunted by the idigenous for food and to make leather from their hide.

properties.name: African Wild Dog
properties.description: The African wild dog hunts a variety of prey such as the eland, impala, wildebeest, and sometimes even buffalo. They usually have a large territorial range. The average pack size is now about 7 to 15 whereas before their decline, packs could be as large as 100 dogs.  The biggest threat to the wild dog is the fact that the human activity in its natural habitat is increasing. Farmers are forcing it off of land to so their animals can graze there. Conservation efforts are hindered by the fact that they have a large range and it is hard to keep them from escaping reserves.

properties.name: African Elephant
properties.description: The African elephant is a herbivore that lives in the African desert and eats grasses, and the leaves, twigs, branches and bark of trees and bushes. It is eaten by some of the big cats that live in Africa, but it usually takes several big cats to take down these large animals. In areas with a large amount of human activity elephants will become nocturnal, but it is mostly active during the day.  Elephants will flap there large ears to help them to cool off.   A lot of watering holes in Africa are made by elephants digging in dry riverbeds searching for water. Whenever elephants knock over trees, it allows smaller animals to be able to eat the leaves. They enlarge or make new caves whenever they are searching for salt, these caves are then used as shelter by other animals. When elephants walk, they stir up insects which are then eaten by birds. For these reasons it is considered to be the keystone species of the African desert biome.

properties.name: Jerboa
properties.description: The jerboa is eaten by many of the small cats in this biome. It eats mainly plants, but will eat insects. It escapes predators by hopping away. Its back legs allow it to hop away from predators. Its long sandy colored hair allows it to blend in to its environment. They are nocturnal which allows them to escape the heat of the days in the desert.

properties.name: Hoodia Gordonii
properties.description: It is a type of cactus that grows in the Kalahari desert. The gemsbok antelope feeds off the hoodia to get water. The San people of the Kalahari use it to ward off hunger and thirst, and have been doing so for centuries.It grows really well in places with high temperatures. Cacti have shallow root systems to more easily collect rain water. The spikes prevent some animals from eating it.

properties.name: African Desert Background/Climate
properties.description: Before it became a desert ecosystem, the African desert was once a Savannah-type environment. The African desert was only a Savannah for a couple hundred years when climate change brought monsoon rains there. Desertification turned it back into a desert and is steadilly increasing the size of this biome.The African Desert biome is one of the hotest desrts in the world. The majority of the this desert recieves only about 2 to 10 cm of water a year. During the day, temperatures can reach as high as 50 degrees celsius and can drop to below freezing during the night.

properties.name: Welwitschia Mirabilis
properties.description: The welwitschia mirabilis is a plant that has only two leaves that continue to grow throughout its whole life. As it gets battered by the wind it makes it look like it has more leaves. The seeds that it produces do not produce a flower.It stays open in foggy weather in order to absorb the moisture from the fog. The welwitschia is believed to live anywhere from 400 to 1500 years. It is thought to have originated from plants from the Jurassic period.

properties.name: Hyena
properties.description: They hyena is both a scavenger and a powerful hunter. They are able to eat the parts of animals that other animals can't. They can take down large prey if they need to.They have a strong digestive track allows them to digest most parts of animals, even bone. They hunt in packs to kill larger prey.

properties.name: Human Use
properties.description: Many of the several species of antelope found in the African Desert are hunted for their horns. Since the price of ivory is high, African elephants are hunted for their tusks. The hoodia Gordonii plant is a key ingredient of most appetite suppressants.The largest diamond mine in the world is found in the Kalahari desert. The African wild dog has become endangered because of being forced off their land by farmers. There is currently a plan in place to plant trees to keep this biome from increasing in size. Some movies have been filmed there because of the beauty of the sandy desert and wars have also been fought here.

properties.name: Fennec Fox
properties.description: The fennec fox is an omnivorous animal that predominantly plants to get water, but will also eat small insects such as beetles or locusts. Like other animals in the desert that can't stand being out all day in the heat, fennec foxes are nocturnal predators. It is able to go its whole life without ever drinking a single drop of water.Its sandy coloration helps it to hide from the predators in its environment. Walking on the hot sand is no problem for the fennec fox because thick padding on its paws protect its feet. It has big ears to help dissipate excess body heat and also to help it hears its prey.

properties.name: Citron Melon
properties.description: The inside of the citron is hard and thus is not usually eaten raw except by animals. It has been domesticated into the watermelon, which is grown in North America. The majority of its composition is comprised of water, which is why come animals such as the gemsbok eat it. This annual plant relies on the animals that eat it because they spread the seeds through their feces. It has a hard outer shell that helps to keep in the water that it stores.

properties.name: Monitor Lizard
properties.description: Monitor lizards eat a large variety of animals including small rodents. Many animals will eat monitor lizards if they find them. Unlike most lizards, monitor lizards will hunt for live prey.They have an increased sense of taste that allows them to sense their prey by tasting the air around them. When a predator tries to grad it by its tail, it falls off and moves around on the ground which helps it escape. They use their forked tongue to sense their environment.

properties.name: Landforms
properties.description: The majority of the African Desert regions is comprised of sand dunes, salt flats, stone plateaus, gravel plains, and dry valleys.There are a few mountains in this region and some of them are volcanic.The sand dunes are constantly changing because of frequent sand storms and dust devils.One unique landform is the Richat Structure which is a circular structure in the desert that looks like a bull's eye.

properties.name: Sea otter
properties.description: I chose the sea otter because it is a major part of the food chain. The sea otter eats fish and clams, but is also preyed upon by sharks and killer whales. The sea otter can be found on beaches around the world and swim into rivers and streams and sometimes oceans in search of food. The sea otter can adapt to curtain biomes like beaches, rivers, and ocean. Some biomes like desert, mountains, and arctic regions cant have sea otters due to the lack of water and good soil. The sea otters need animals to eat like fish and it’s going to be hard to find a fish in the desert and mountain regions.

properties.name: Great White shark
properties.description: I chose the great white shark because they help control the population of fish and seals in the neritic zone. without the great white in the shallow beach areas, the fish population would increase greatly. The great white is on the top of the food chain because nothing in the ocean tries to kill the great white for food. Some characteristics make the great white a fierce hunter, like they can smell blood 3 miles away. They are very strong, they have a one ton bite force and weigh six tons. Due to the great whites smell and speed, they are the top predator in the ocean. The great white can only adapt to salt water ocean waters, it can't go on land or into fresh water rivers, ponds, lakes, etc.

properties.name: Blue Crab
properties.description: The crab is my fourth top five animal because they are very special. The crab can go under the water in search for food and go onto land to get food. The crab would probably be in the middle of the chain only because they hunt wounded fish and bugs but are eaten by some fish, birds and sea otters. The blue crab can reach up to 9in. long and 1 1/2 years old. This crab lives in the ocean, eating wounded or leftovers from fish attacks, shark attacks, and just older fish that couldn't swim anymore. Many blue crabs have been caught by fishers in the ocean and tourists on the beaches.

properties.name: Krill
properties.description: The krill is my fifth animal on my top five. the krill feed on plankton and other very small organisms that live in the ocean. Id place the krill close to the bottom of the food chain b/c the krill eats some small things but is also eaten by tons of fish, and whales. They are also the main food source for marine animals and fish. "The krill is a very very tiny organism, it also somewhat looks like a shrimp. Actually, the krill is a shrimp but one type of species of shrimp. The krill is able to adapt to its biome by feeding on the plankton and other small organisms on the top of the water and the bottom.

properties.name: Patch Reef
properties.description: They are on the top of the food chain cause they arent preyed upon by other animals. This animal lives in on the bottom and sides of the ocean, they are homes to curtain fish and eat curtain fish that they catch. The coral reefs don't move but are still able to catch fish. The patch reefs adapt to the biome very well, they live on the ocean bottom and eat whatever happens to come within reach of them. They are able to survive due to the sun that shines down on them through the shallow water. The patch reefs are able to stick fish to themselves and eat them in the process.

properties.name: Green Algae
properties.description: One of the top 5 plants is green algae. the algae lives on sides of rocks, walls, reefs and sometimes on the ground. The algae is an important part in the food chain, which the algae provides food for animals and shelter for some fish. Some animals like the raccoon, oppusoms and skunks would eat green algae if they cant catch any fish. This type of algae green so its very easy to see in the water, like when you go fishing and you see green stuff on top of rocks and stones, that green covering is the algae.     The algae relys on sunlight and a place to surface in order to live. It adapts very well in rivers that usually get a lot of sunlight, but the algae doesnt always have to be where there is sunlight. Algae can live on rocks that do not have any sunlight hitting them, usually this means that the rocks used to be hit by sunlight.

properties.name: Alaskan Kelp
properties.description: "The next plant on my top is the alaskan kelp. Kelp is a type of seaweed that is very useful in the neritic zone, the kelp provides food for animals and also shelter and protection from larger fish or animals that might want to eat the little fish. Many animals eat kelp like dolphins, manatees, hippos and sometimes large deer if they can reach it. The Kelp can expand into forest-like groupings of kelp, which provides a lot of shelter but also a lot of food for hungery animals."     "The kelp relys on sunlight to survive and must have good ground in order to grow. some adaptations about kelp is that it is usually skinny, like paper thin. Sense the kelp is paper thin, it is also very flexible, and doesn't require a lot of force in order to move it. Another adaptation would be that it comes in many sizes, some pieces of kelp could be as long as 6 feet and as short as 6 inches. Some alaskan kelp has been found that streaches three-four times the length of humans."

properties.name: Green Moss
properties.description: Green Moss is almost the same as algae but sometimes thicker and greener, which makes the moss my third plant. The moss can be food to many animals like insects, birds, and mammals. Deer, rodents, livestock and raccoon sized animals will eat moss. In order for moss to survive they need something to attach to like a tree or a rock. Sense moss is sorta like sponge, its adaptation makes it able to suck in water from near by puddles, rivers, and ponds which builds up in the moss causing it to spread.      The moss does help shelter small animals and insects but not very well. There are some adaptations to the moss like is able to spread from one tree to a rock and back to another tree, this helps its survival by copying its self. Sometimes the moss can absorb so much water that it could cover a huge boulder or even half a huge tree.

properties.name: Phytoplankton
properties.description: The phytoplankton is at the base of the food chain for the ocean, for this reason it becomes my fourth plant. phytoplankton are very very small plants that live in the ocean. They start the food chain at the base, then they are eaten by little fish and whales. Like most plants, the phytoplankton relys on sunlight in order to live.     Phytoplankton have some adaptations that help it survive like sunlight and water. sunlight supplies phytoplankton with light and the plant is able to grow and expand. Another adaptation is its size, since phytoplankton is so small it is able to live longer and grow longer. Without phytoplankton, some marine life would be more limited on food and would have to find another favorite food to eat.

properties.name: Posidonia(seagrass)
properties.description: The Posidonia is a type of sea grass, which is very important to the food chain and helps put sea grass as my fifth plant. Posidonia is one of the sea grass families. Sea grass is a type of plant that lives under water and provides oxygen like those that live on land. Sea grass doesn't eat anything but does provide shelter and food for other fi     "There are some adaptations that the sea grass uses to survive like it needs sunlight in order it live. The sea grass is at the base of the food chain which starts the movement of the chain. Without sea grass, some animals would have more of a limit on food and would have to find some other kind of food that is avliable. Many animals eat sea grass like manatees, otters, hippos, seals, and sea lions."

properties.name: Kemp's Ridley
properties.description: The Kemp's Ridley is my first animal on my top due to the fact that they are the most endangered sea turtle in the world. This turtle is one of the smallest turtles around, and normally is found in shallow water feeding off of crabs. The reason why this turtle is endangered is that thousands of nests are destroyed and there is no where to nest.     The Kemp's Ridley has some adaptations that help it survive, they stay near shallow water for food and will leave the shallow water to go out into the ocean. This turtle is preyed upon by some large fish like sharks, barrachuda, and other large toothed fish. Without the Kemp's Ridley we would have lost a turtle species and interesting turtles at zoos.

properties.name: Leatherback Sea Turtle
properties.description: The leatherback sea turtle is the largest sea turtle in the world which helps bring this turtle to my top. The leatherback sea turtle gets its name from its shell which is a leather-like skin on the shell. These turtles go onto land to build their nest and lay their eggs, after that they return to the ocean for food.    "The leatherback sea turtle has many ways of adapting, they have strong jaws for eating and catching prey and are very very good swimmers. These turtles are like the Kemp's Ridley but alot bigger and eats fish, crabs, shrimp, and squids. This turtle can be eaten large fish like sharks, and other toothed fish, but are also eaten by humans. Many humans catch turtles in nets and will eat them reguardless wat type of turtle they are."

properties.name: Humans use neritic zone
properties.description: Humans use the neritic zone for many many reasons, they use it to fish, swim, boat, competitions, and trash dumping. The main good reason is for fishing, people all over the world use the neritic zone for fishing small fish and big fish. In some places of the world championship fishing tours are hosted in the neritic zone of almost all states near the coast. Swimming is also used which is a good thing as well, many people have beaches in the neritic zone like daytonna beach and maryland beach.    Along with the good reasons there are always bad reasons, like people dumping trash into the water and polluting the water with toxic waste and chemicals. The trash, toxic waste, and chemicals are the reason why many animals that live in the neritic zone die off and become extinct. Many people dump trash and stuff into the neritic zone cause their to lazy to take it to the dump or actually want to kill off animals. When you go to the beach anywhere in the world and you see trash in the water or your swimming and feel trash on the bottom, you know that people have once dumped trash into the water and thats why fish and other animals are hard to find anymore.

properties.name: humans use neritic zone 2
properties.description: There are many landforms that must be present in order to have the neritic zone. In order to have the neritic zone, the earth must have a beach or coastal plain. Then it must have an oceanic zone, which is the main source of the neritic zone; it supplies the food and the area of the zone. Without the beach, there can't be a neritic zone and without the oceanic zone, there actually wouldnt be a ocean. So, there are many landforms that are needed in order to have a neritic zone.     "The continental shelf is really the neritic zone but in a different term, the shelf streaches out from the land to the ocean. The shelf isnt all of the ocean, it goes about miles out into the ocean but starts at the water's surface or where the water touches land. The continental shelf is what some countries use to call their territorial waters, this is where most countries that had water near them got their natural resources from like food, water and shelter. This is why the continental shelf is similiar to the neritic zone cause at both places is where alot of activity is being done."

properties.name: Agriculture
properties.description: There are many animals that live in the neritic zone that are grown by people like fish, different types of plants, coral reefs, and reptiles. People must use the neritic zone in order to keep their animal/animals they are taking care of alive. What most people do is they use the neritic zone waters to keep fish that they are gonna use for fishing one day or just for fun alive, using the this area would work better than using little rivers, ponds, and open oceans.    "Due to people using the neritic zone as a home for their aquatic pets, it is being used and trash and other chemical stuff are being dumped in theses waters. The people that own animals there probobly wouldnt dump trash but other people that dont care would dump trash/chemicals, thus killing tons of thousands of animals and fish that live in the neritic zone and the open ocean."

properties.name: Tourism
properties.description: Some tourist attractions are placed in the neritic zone like cruise ships, farries, beaches for swimming and some times carnivals. The cruise ships and farries give tourists the ability to see out into the ocean and able to get away from land and enjoy the sea. Beaches supply the tourists with a place to swim and fish, many tourists love to swim in the oceans and see fish as they swim and others like going to the beaches for some good fishing. Carnivals are sometimes noticed on a pier out over top the water and sometimes directly on top the water, theres many different carnivals that are above the neritic zone including Sea World    "Also due to many people using the neritic zone for tourism and entertinment, tons of trash and garbage are being thrown over board or off the deck. Not only is trash a problem but with these attractions over the water, many fish and animals are losing their homes due to building development. This is one of the reasons why the neritic zone is losing fish population along with garbage and trash being dumped into it."

properties.name: conservation
properties.description: "The conservation of the neritic zone is when the animals and plants are moved in order to protect their habitats. This is needed not only due to garbage, tousim, and human amusement, but also due to larger animals moving into their homes and eating everything in site. There have be causes where many large fish that dont normally come into the neritic zone have been found in this region searching for food."    "Scientists have been doing a conservation on the neritic zone for a while now only because this region is among one of the most used in the world today. This is also where the start of most animals began, from being a animal that can only live in water to a new animal that can go either place. The neritic zone supplies food and water not just for water animals but for land animals as well."

They can smell seals on ice from 20 miles away.The polar bear lives in a den or a cave. They have black skin to absorb more heat. properties.name: Vampire Bat
properties.description: The Vampire Bat eats the blood of horses, burros, cattle, pigs, and tapirs. They live in trees high off the ground so their predators can’t eat them. They hunt for their prey at night so they don’t get eaten their selves. They aren’t endangered. I picked it because it keeps the animal population down but not too much. This is also why they are important. Vampire bats only hunt in the dark because they are less likely to get caught by their predator. Another reason is their prey is often sleeping so it is easier to bite them. They will often move from roost to roost to get closer to their prey. They also use rivers for navigation so they don’t get lost. Rivers tend to be easier to follow than wooded areas. They give the bats easy access to cattle. It walks by lifting its self up onto its hind legs. It has a thumb claw that sticks out from the front edge of the wing that it uses for climbing around its prey. They are important because they keep the wild animal population down.

properties.name: American Flamingo
properties.description: It is the brightest of is subspecies. Its colors are pink with black feathers. The difference in the colors depends on their different kinds of diets. They eat seeds, blue-green algae, crustaceans, and mollusks. I picked this animal because it keeps the sea creatures down but not too much. This is also why it is important.    While they hold their beak upside down in the water, they suck it in and filter minute organisms by a comb–like projection, thus leaving the food behind.  The water and large food items are kept out by the slits. The legs are long which allows them to go into much deeper water.  They are also good swimmers and waders.  Their webbing in their feet helps them walk on soft mud.

properties.name: Jambu Fruit Dove
properties.description: The Jambu Fruit Dove eats fruit directly from the trees that other animals have dropped. They drink by putting their whole beak into the water and sucking it in. I picked these because they eat the fruits that other animals drop and that keeps them from going to waste. This is also why they are important.Their nose is raised on its upper bill unlike most birds. Its color helps it blend in and hide from its predators. They spend most of their time in trees, except for when they eat.

properties.name: Keel Billed Toucan
properties.description: The keel-billed toucan is omnivorous. It mainly eats fruits, like the banana passion fruit, but occasionally eats insects, reptiles, birds and eggs, and tree frogs.  It lives in the trees in the South American Tropical Rainforest. I picked this bird because I think that it is important because it eats both fruits and some pesky insects. It also keeps the insect population down. This is also why they are important.It adapted into being a fruit eater. It adapted its bill to be light and long so it could reach fruit easier. It adapted to having good eyesight.

properties.name: Blue-Tongued Skink
properties.description: The blue-tongued skinks are omnivores and eat many types of foods.  They eat insects, snails, carrion, wildflowers, fruits and berries. It is a ground-dweller. They are omnivores and eat many foods. I picked this animal because I think that being a ground-dweller you would need to keep your energy up and that is what it does by eating all those insects and other plants and snails. It also helps keep the plant population down. This is also why they are important.If it is attacked at the tail, it will detach so it can get away. Once it is broken off, it will wiggle for sometime, consuming all the attention from its owner. They have large teeth that they use for crunching snail shells and other hard parts. They expand their ribcage and hiss to ward off any predators.

properties.name: Curare
properties.description: The Native American would crush and cook the roots and stems. Then they would mix it with other plants, put it on their bows and hunt for wild game. The word curare means poison it Native American language. It has heart shaped leaves. It grows fruits that animals can’t eat because they will die from the poison. It is important because we use it for medicine. We use the ingredient D-tubocurarine for our medicines to treat edema, fever, and kidney stones. It is used externally for bruises.It has adapted to the climate. It also adapted to the amount of water that rains there. It adapted to protecting itself from the things that try to eat it.

properties.name: Kapok Tree
properties.description: This is a home for many animals. They live and grow up in them. This is why they are important. They are drought deciduous. They shed most of their leaves in the dry season. We use it to treat dysentery, fever, asthma, and kidney disease. People use it to make dugout canoes. It is an important niche. It provides a home for plants that depend on sunlight. They provide a home and food for most animals. It provides a way for animals that live in the trees to get around without having to walk on the ground.They have adapted to having all sunlight. It adapted to having a lot of animals live in it. It has adapted to the amount of rainfall. It has adapted to having animals swinging, jumping, on them. Also breaking their branches.

properties.name: Strangler Fig
properties.description: It is considered to be the keystone species because they grow fruit several times a year and this helps the animals survive because they have a huge supply of food. It feeds most of the omnivores and herbivores. I chose it because it is the keystone species. It sends tiny roots that grow down a host tree. Then they grow down into the host tree’s root and fight it for water and nutrients. When it gets bigger the roots grow leave and strangles the host tree until it dies. That is why it is called the strangler fig. It adapted to having little sunlight and a lot of competition for water and nutrients. It also adapted to surviving around trees that try to crowd them out. They have adapted to the warm and hot weather. As it grows it climbs up the host tree and grows leaves. As it grows it kills it.

properties.name: Bougainvillea
properties.description: This is a plant that animals or insects don’t eat. It likes to live in the subtropical climate but will adapt to any climate. It likes wooded areas or areas with a lot of plants so it can climb up them for sunlight. It doesn’t like swampy areas because of all the water. It can live in full sun, but likes partial sun. It can live it areas with a lot of water, but it doesn’t like to because it doesn’t like to hold the water for long periods of time.  I picked this plant because it provides a house for many animals although they don’t eat it.It adapted to the climate and environment. It has hooks to cling onto trees and other plants for support.  It has adapted to having full sunlight to having mostly shade. It adapted to having a lot of rainfall by having its leaves have drip tips in them so the excess water runs off. It can become a houseplant by adapting to the temperature of your house.

properties.name: Bengal Bamboo
properties.description: It grows as undergrowth or patches in the rainforest. It likes moist environments with tons of rainfall. It has dark green straight stalky culms. These culms are the stems. They only flower once and die after they bloom. I picked because it helps the rainforest and shelters most animals. It soaks up most of the water and keeps the rainforest from flooding.The Bengal Bamboo has adapted to all the rainfall. It soaks up most of the water and keeps the rainforest from flooding.  It adapted to supporting the animals that live in them. They adapted to part of the stalk having sunlight and part of it not having sunlight.

properties.name: Brown Spider Monkey
properties.description: Their diet consists of 90% fruit and nuts. They eat the fruits whole. If food is low they may eat insects, bark or rotting forest, and honey. They live in groups of 15-25 monkeys and if needed break up into groups 2-8 monkeys. Their tails have highly flexible hairless tips with skin grooves that help to them grip on to things like tree branches. They also possess narrow and thumb less, hook-like hands, with fingers that are long and curved. If they cannot find food for the whole group then they will split into smaller groups so they can find food easier. They split up in groups so it is easier to find food. They are endangered because people like to eat them. They are easy to find because they are noisy and tend to travel in big groups.

properties.name: Golden-bellied Capuchin
properties.description: They eat fruits, nuts, seeds and buds, and also insects, spiders, bird eggs and small vertebrates. This makes them omnivores. They also live near water and will also eat crabs and shellfish by cracking their shells open with the stones. Their enemies are large falcons, cats, and snakes. They are the smartest of New World monkeys. It is going extinct because its habitat has been broken up because of logging and agriculture. This has led it to be in isolated populations and inbreeding.They sleep wedged in between the branches of trees so it makes it harder for the wild cats and bird to get to them. They see Macaws eating some palm nuts, and cracking them open with their beaks. Then the capuchins will pick some of the ripest fruits, bite off the tip of the fruit and drink all the juice, then discard the rest of the fruit with the nut inside. When these discarded fruits have hardened and become slightly brittle, they will gather them up again and take them to a large flat boulder where they have previously gathered a few river stones from up to a mile away. They will then use these stones, some of them weighing as much as the monkeys, to crack open the fruit to get to the nut inside. Young capuchins will watch this process to learn from the older, more experienced adults.

properties.name: Strangler Fig
properties.description: It is considered to be the keystone species because they grow fruit several times a year and this helps the animals survive because they have a huge supply of food. It feeds most of the omnivores and herbivores. I chose it because it is the keystone species. It sends tiny roots that grow down a host tree. Then they grow down into the host tree’s root and fight it for water and nutrients. When it gets bigger the roots grow leave and strangles the host tree until it dies. That is why it is called the strangler fig. It adapted to having little sunlight and a lot of competition for water and nutrients. It also adapted to surviving around trees that try to crowd them out. They have adapted to the warm and hot weather. As it grows it climbs up the host tree and grows leaves. As it grows it kills it.

properties.name: Backgound Information
properties.description: The rainforest is wet most of the year. It has what we call a dry season, which is during our winter. Today it covers less than 6% of our Earth’s surface. They produce 40% of our oxygen.  It is a home to many animals that we have not discovered yet along with the ones we have. It bares more than 100-300 different species of trees. Every animal in one rainforest differs from the same animal in another rainforest. The South American Tropical Rainforest has many species of monkeys, but the some species of monkeys in the Asian Rainforest differ from the ones in the South American Tropical Rainforest. Each Tropical Rainforest trees differ from the other, as the animals do.The average rainfall ranges from 50-260 inches (125-660 cm.) a year. The rainfall is often over 100 inches per year. The temperature is no higher than 93˚F (34˚ C) and no lower than 68˚ F (20˚C). The humidity is between 77-88%.

properties.name: Angel Falls
properties.description: Angel Falls (Venezuela): This is the worlds highest waterfall. They named it “Angel Falls” because a guy name Jimmy Angel flew discovered it. It borders Venezuela and Brazil. It is located in the Canaima National Park in Bolivar State, along Venezuela’s border with Brazil.It is so high that before the water reaches the bottom of the fall it has already evaporated. It is 9 times higher than the Niagra Falls. It is called Kerepakupai merú which means “waterfall of the deepest place”. Sir Walter Raleigh was said to have discovered it a couple of times, but these claims are said to be “far-fetched”.

properties.name: Human Use
properties.description: We get our oxygen from their trees. This is where some of our fruits came from. Here are some examples: avocados, coconuts, figs, oranges, lemons, grapefruit, bananas, guavas, pineapples, mangos and tomatoes. It is also where some of our vegetables, herbs, spices, and nuts came from. Here is some examples: corn, potatoes, rice, winter squash and yams; spices like black pepper, cayenne, chocolate, cinnamon, cloves, ginger, sugar cane, tumeric, coffee and vanilla and nuts including Brazil nuts and cashews. We use the trees for lumber and paper.We use some of the plants for medical reasons. The Madagascar  periwinkle is one of the most powerful anticancer drug in the rainforest. We use the wild yam for birth control pills. We have discovered 121 different medicines from the south american tropical rainforest. Cranberry juice as well as the Saw Palmetto help to reduce bladder infections Forms of garlic are used to treat asthma and bronchitis (Garib-Fakeem). Garlic and Aloe Vera are used to help manage diabetes. Motherwort is known to strenthen the heart and to counteract PMS, menstrual pain, and delayed menstruation. Mayapple is used to treat skin cancer, the Pacific Yew tree is used to stop the growth of tumors, and the Xi Shu is used to fight against Leukemia (Balunas). Malasian tree is known to treat AIDS. Mamala and the woody vine Ancistrocladus are used to treat HIV.

properties.name: Agriculture
properties.description: The soil has many minerals and nutrients. People used to clear rainforests to grow crops. The nutrient never enter the minerals soil. The agriculture is needed to host larger population. People go through slashing and burning the plants and they don’t grow back. It is mostly clay.The industrial agriculture is a big threat to the rainforest. We are cutting down way to many of the trees and killing too many homes that the trees provides for the animals to live in. The heavy rainfalls are disolveing the nutrients that the trees need to survive. The people that lives in the rainforest hunt and kill some of the animals that provides some of the neurients and minerals for the soil.

properties.name: Iguazzu Falls
properties.description: Iguazu Falls (Brazil):It is part of the Iguazu River. It is has a u-shaped formation that is said to look like the devils throat. This is what the formation is actually call the Devil’s Throat. It is located on the border of the Brazilian state of Paraná and the Argentine province of Misiones. The falls can be reached from the two main towns on either side of the falls.On the Brazilian side there is a long walkway along the canyon with an extension to the lower base of the Devil's Throat. The Argentine side Brings People to different walkways. The Paseo Garganta del Diablo is a one-kilometer-long trail that brings the visitor directly over the falls of the Devil's Throat. Other walkways allow access to the elongated stretch of falls on the Argentine side and to the ferry that connects to the San Martin island.There is a legend that goes with it. Here it is: Legend has it that a god planned to marry a beautiful aborigine named Naipí, who fled with her mortal lover Tarobá in a canoe. In rage, the god sliced the river creating the waterfalls, condemning the lovers to an eternal fall. This is the words biggest water fall.

properties.name: Conservation
properties.description: They use a system called the Holdridge system It is widely used for conservation purposes. Its use is far from feasible in tropics. Instead, the future in classifying tropical rainforest plant formations may lie in remote sensing, where large areas can be mapped relatively quickly.  This system is used to map out the average total annual percipitation(mm) and the potential evapotranspiration ratio. They use a different part to measure the mean annual biotemperature.They use a system called the Holdridge system It is widely used for conservation purposes. Its use is far from feasible in tropics. Instead, the future in classifying tropical rainforest plant formations may lie in remote sensing, where large areas can be mapped relatively quickly.  This system is used to map out the average total annual percipitation(mm) and the potential evapotranspiration ratio. They use a different part to measure the mean annual biotemperature.

properties.name: Harpy Eagle
benthos
properties.description: The Benthos are located near the seabed. This area is also known as the benthic zone, this is how they got their name. They live near marine environments. Most of the benthos can not adapt to live in the upper parts of the water column. They are often times not able to adapt because of the very significant pressure difference. The main food source of the benthos is plankton. The number of benthos that are able to survive in an area has to deal with temperature, amount of salt in the area, and depth of the water. Some different scavengers and predators that are considered to be benthic organisms are sea stars, and snails.Sea stars, oysters, clams, sea cucumbers, and brittle stars are some organisms that play an important role in the food source of fish and also for humans. Different types of Benthos are determined by their particular size. The reason it is relatively easy for the Benthic organisms to survive in the Pelagic zone is because of their ability to pass easily with the water currents. They normally adapt easily to an area once they have found a plenty amount food, water, shelter, and of course space. The benthos are also like the ground-fish they have the ability to survive near the bottom of the water.

properties.name: dolphin fish
properties.description: The third animal that i chose for my top five was the dolphin fish. It is also known as the dorado. They are fast growing with a typically short life span. Males grow faster and this causes them to have a shorter life span than females.dolphin fishes long nose is one of the many things that help them to adapt to different areas. Because of their relatively long nose this helps them in the process of killing sharks. Its fin moves from side to side and its tail moves up and down which helps them to dive and get air. The dolphins blubber helps them to stay warm in the cold water. The dolphin fish only has one set of teeth these are used to help them catch fish.The forth animal i chose is the manta ray. It is the largest ray throughout the world and lives mostly in tropical waters. Most people believe that the manta ray comes from various bottom feeding.

properties.name: manta ray
properties.description: The forth animal i chose is the manta ray. It is the largest ray throughout the world and lives mostly in tropical waters. Most people believe that the manta ray comes from various bottom feeding.A manta ray is not considered to be a mammel. They are known to be related to sharks. They normally adapt close to reef habitats and offshore islands. They swim by flapping there large fins. They often times migrate in temperate waters.

properties.name: gulper eel
properties.description: The fifth and final animal that i chose to be the top most important is the gulper eel which has a very unusual appearence. It has a large mouth with an unhinged jaw. They are normally 2-4 feet long and a spotted brown to black color.The gulper eel has to acquire adaptation to live in deep areas with little food. at the tip of its tail it has a bioluminescense which helps to attract prey and mates. It is able to survive off of few organisms that are found in its depths.

properties.name: algae
properties.description: The first plant that I chose to be in the top five that I felt was the most important is algae. Algae helps to support the life of the animals. Although they lack some important organs found in land plants they are still technically considered to be plants. All true algae has a nucleus enclosed within a membrane. They help to produce oxygen which in turn helps humans. Algae received its name from the Latin word seaweed. Algae is a biological classification.Algae is one of the main plants that have discovered the possibility of adaptation, even though the vegetation underwater is not very large in the Pelagic zone. The main type of competition for algae is for the amount of space which helps to determine growth. Fish consume the most amount of organisms in the Pelagic zone so therefore they have the ability to alter the growth of the algae. Algae has a very good ability to adapt because it has a chemical defense system and good cooperation with other organisms.

properties.name: coral reef
properties.description: The second plant that I felt was important is the coral reef. Coral reef is a structure that is produced by living organisms. They are found in marine waters that have very little to no nutrients in the water. Coral reef encourages the growth of algae. There are many different types of coral reef, where it is located determines the name of it. Coral reef is normally colorful, if there are fish inside the coral reef then in that case it will have more color. Coral reef does not live in the west coast of America. The best condition for the coral reef to adapt is in warm waters because there is activities to lead there formation. To adapt to different areas the coral reef has to be able to swim, not drown, and they need to like water. Coral reef serves as an important part to help with adaptations, it serves as food, a place of refuge, a home and most important a hiding place. The coral reef has a large amount of responsibility to help make other organisms survive. It helps to make a living society for other organisms which in turn helps for other organisms to adapt quicker.

properties.name: tamarack
properties.description: The third plant that i chose to be in my top five is tamarack, this is a species of larch. This tree is very cold tolerant which means that it is able to survive very cold winters. Its wood is tough and durable, but it is also flexible when cut into thin strips. It use to be used in older ages to snowshoes, this goes to show just how strong it really is. It is commonly found in swamps but it can also be found in drier sandy area's.The tamarack tree does very good with adapting to other areas. It has the ability to adapt to other areas because of its ability to survive in very cold temperatures. This makes them be able to live through long cold winters. This wood is rot resistant. This type of wood is normally found in bushes and light and easy to carry.

properties.name: sedge
properties.description: The forth plant i chose to be in my top five of most important was a sedge. The sedge is a marshland plant. They grow in damp ground or shallow water. They are a family grass-like and rush-like herbs. This species is widely distributed but growing in all kinds of different situations. There are many different types of sedges some are found in swampy areas, some in dry areas, but some can also be found in your own lawn.The sedge lives in many different areas, so therefore it is easily adapted. They are able to adapt from wetlands to areas with very poor soil. There ability to do this is rather amazing, since they are two completely different areas with different types of nutrients and other rather large factors. Most sedges have triangular stems, and there leaves are spirally arranged into three different ranks

properties.name: kelp
properties.description: The fifth and final plant that i chose as five of the most important located in the Pelagic zone is kelp. Kelp are large seaweeds, they belong to the group of brown algae. There are about thirty different types of kelp. Some of the species can be long and are also able to form kelp forests. In most kelp the body consists of flat or leaf-like structures that are known as blades. The growth of the kelp can be limited depending on the type of animals that live in, on, or even around the area that the kelp lives in. This could definatly not have one of the best effects on the adaptation of kelp and other animals.There are many different things that have an effect on whether or not kelp is able to adapt easily to other places and many reasons of why they are one of the few plants that are able to survive in the Pelagic zone. The reason kelp has the ability to survive in area's that other animals are not able to is because they have different types of energy that allows them to live in allot of different area's. Some rich soil content also has a major effect on there ability to adapt to other different biomes. The kelp is able to adapt with very little problems to areas that have plenty of food, shelter, and protection from animals that make them be in danger for their lives. This particular type of algae is under a threat. One danger that kelp has is the fear of pollution. Another one that is very important is global warming because it works against the cold water habitat of the kelp.

properties.name: stellar sea lion
properties.description: Also known to be endangered in the Pelagic zone is the Stellars sea lion. It is located in the east pacific, stretching from california to japan. Some different things that are considered to be threatening towards the life of this species is competitive fishing, drowning in nets, and deliberate killing by fisherman poachers.Adult sea lions are usually darker in color then sea lions that are younger in age. Males are often times broader in size with larger foreheads, and flatter noses. Males are also slightly longer than most females. Both male and female sea lions grow rapidly until about there fifth year. Stellar sea lion pups are born with being the color black. After time though there color starts to fade to the color that they should be a very light tan. The stellar sea lions are normally hunted for meat which has a huge leading effect on there extinction. Another huge effect is them being killed intentionally by fisherman. Killing sea lions is strictly prohibited in the U.S, Canada, Russia and Japan. But it is legal for them to be removed by a group of people if they need to secure the fact that there fishery is protected. http://nhs.needham.k12.ma.us//cur/bio_99/p1/tv_kr_p1/marine.htm

properties.name: piscivore
properties.description: he keystone species that is located in the Pelagic zone is the Piscivores. Piscivores are at the top of the food chain, they are fish eating fish. They eat fish like bass, pike, and walleye. If the Piscivore population is too high, they could eat all of the Planktivores. If there was less planktivores then the zooplankton population could increase and do a much better job at feeding off of the algae. This in turn would increase the transperecy of the lake. If there would get to be a small number of Piscivores, the exact opposite could happen. The reason for the Piscivore population to decrease to a very low amount would be a result of overfishing or even poor reproduction.Most Piscivores are strictly dependent on fish for food. A Piscivore is a carnivore like animal that relies on fish as the main source of food. The name piscivore comes from the latin word piscis. The piscivorous fish are increased in lakes.

properties.name: ground fish
properties.description: The ground-fish also known as bottom feeders live in or near the bottom of the body of ocean in which they live. Some of the saltwater species that they inhabit are the sole, flounder, and halibut. There are very few ground-fish species that live in freshwater. Some typical types of ground fish live only in salt-water which makes it hard if not impossible to adapt to an area that consists of freshwater. It is very difficult for ground fish to survive in fresh water areas. It is also legal to harvest ground fish however there is a large number of federal types of regulations in the United States.Some characteristics that helps the ground-fish to survive in the Pelagic zone is the fact that they are able to stay very near to the bottom of the body of water. The ground-fish is struggling unlike other animals to survive. Part of the reason that they are struggling is because of different fleets sent out because of the ground-fish.

properties.name: backround
properties.description: The pelagic zone is the area of the ocean on the outside of coastal areas. This area is where you will find some of the largest marine species. The sea floor is not included to be in the pelagic zone. The pelagic zone is divided into smaller areas depending on there water depths. Normally the types of animals that you will find is large fish and some certain crustations. There are some invertebraes such as jellyfish. In deeper areas you'll find giant squid, and some prime foods for others animals. Over half of the ocean is over 3,000 meters deep. ONe of the most dramatic climate changes that could have effects on the pelagic zone is tropical cyclones. These are also known as typhoons and hurricanes. The Earths climates are greatly changed by ocean currents. They can be caused by transferring cold and warm air, and different ranges of perticipation.

properties.name: landforms
properties.description: The ocean covers more than seventy-one percent of the Earths surface. Only sixty-five percent of that is considered to be open ocean. The average ocean has the average depth of about two miles and even the deepest bottoms include life. The life in the ocean is divided into two major categories, these are the benthic environment or the sea floor and the pelagic environment, also known as the ocean waters. It is then further divided into categories that are based on the depth of the water. Areas can also be further divided into physical and biological conditions of the ocean. These categories can be sub-divided into categories that focus on light abundance. Humans use the pelagic zone for fishing and even some poachers come to use and reuse this area. The region where photosynthesis most commonly occurs is the photic zone. Its water level is nearly 200 meters down. THis region also contains the largest biodiversity in the ocean. Plants can only survive where there is photosynthesis so therefore any material found in the ocean that is lower than this would have to rely on material floating in the ocean,

properties.name: agriculture
properties.description: Conservation is being protected and keeping safe. In the Pelagic zone is protected by the sediment surface and some sub-surface layers. Certain zones provide many valuable products and ecological services. The Pelagic zone is just the more descriptive term for the ecological region above the bentho's, this includes the water column that travels up to the surface of the ocean. In this area there is a large range of animals that exist in this area. There is a certain view in the Pelagic zone that is meant to detect ecosystem change in response to environmental reasoning such as climate change to the over-fishing that is constantly happening in this biome. ecosystem indicators can be applied in a serial fashion, Tourist attractions include many parts nearby Chile. Chile has a very diverse coastal zone. also the coastal zone can vary with very little effect. Some different characteristics in the Chile areas has provided the coast of Chile with certain important pelagic fisheries in the country's north and center. they have also made Benthonic fisheries in the south.

properties.name: climate
properties.description: he pelagic zone is the area of the ocean on the outside of coastal areas. This area is where you will find some of the largest marine species. The sea floor is not included to be in the pelagic zone. The pelagic zone is divided into smaller areas depending on there water depths. Normally the types of animals that you will find is large fish and some certain crustations. There are some invertebraes such as jellyfish. In deeper areas you'll find giant squid, and some prime foods for others animals. Over half of the ocean is over 3,000 meters deep. ONe of the most dramatic climate changes that could have effects on the pelagic zone is tropical cyclones. These are also known as typhoons and hurricanes. The Earths climates are greatly changed by ocean currents. They can be caused by transferring cold and warm air, and different ranges of perticipation.

properties.name: winter run chinook salman
properties.description: The first animal that i would like to mention that is endangered in the area that i am researching is the winter-run chinook salmon. This type of animal is found in the east pacific normally in the stretch from California to Washington. They are considered to be endangered because of water diversion, excessive dams, water pollution, and abundant predators. The winter-run Chinook Salmon was marked to endangered in April of 1989. The Chinook salmon is the largest out of all the salmon. Adults normally can exceed forty pounds. Chinook salmon is the state fish of Alaska. The Chinook salmon is very similar to the coho salmon in appearance, while at sea. The only difference is there relatively large size, small black spots on there tail lobes, and black pigment along the base of the teeth. Adults migrate from a marine environment into the freshwater streams. They spawn only once and then they die. The population depends on the maturity or age and difference in size. Some of these salmon stay a few months to years in fresh water before moving onto other area's.

properties.name: Orangutan
properties.description: The name orangutanis derived from the Malay and Indonesian words orang meaning "person" and hutan meaning "forest",thus "person of the forest".  Fruit makes up 65% of the orangutan diet.The fruit of fig trees are also commonly eaten since it is easy to both harvest and digest.Bornean orangutans are recorded to consume at least 317 different food items and include: young leaves, shoots, seeds and bark. Insects, honey and bird eggs are also included.  The Sumatran species is critically endangered and the Bornean species of orangutans is endangered according to theICUN RED LIST of mammals and both are listed on Appendix I of CITES.

properties.name: Tapir
properties.description: Adult tapirs are large enough that they have few natural predators, and the thick skin on the backs of their necks helps to protect them from threats such as jaguars, crocodiles, anacondas, and tigers Hunting for meat and hides has substantially reduced their numbersTapir are classified as vulnerable.There are a number of conservation projects around the world.
