The Tapir Specialist Group, a unit of the IUCN Species Survival Commission, strives to conserve biological diversity by stimulating, developing, and executing practical programs to study, save, restore, and manage the four species of tapir and their remaining habitats in Central and South America and Southeast Asia.There are a number of conservation projects around the world. The Tapir Specialist Group, a unit of the IUCN Species Survival Commission, strives to conserve biological diversity by stimulating, developing, and executing practical programs to study, save, restore, and manage the four species of tapir and their remaining habitats in Central and South America and Southeast Asia.

properties.name: Burmese Python
properties.description: The Burmese Python (Python molurus bivittatus), is the largest subspecies of the Indian Pythonnative to rain forest areas of Southeast Asia. The Burmese Python is found throughout Southeast Asia including Burma (Myanmar), Thailand, Cambodia, Vietnam, China, and Indonesia.The captive breeding of Burmese pythons in the Americas has led to some rather serious problems. People who grow tired of their pythons, or whose pythons have grown too large to be kept in their houses, have been known to release their pets into the wild rather than have them euthanised.The captive breeding of Burmese pythons in the Americas has led to some rather serious problems. People who grow tired of their pythons, or whose pythons have grown too large to be kept in their houses, have been known to release their pets into the wild rather than have them euthanised.

properties.name: Sun Bear
properties.description: The Sun Bear (Helarctos malayanus) is a bear found primarily in the tropical rainforests of Southeast Asia. Its Malay and Indonesian name is Beruang Madu ("Honey Bear").The diet of the Sun Bear varies widely and includes small vertebrates, such as lizards, birds, and other mammals, in addition to fruits, eggs, termites, the young tips of palm trees, nests of bees, berries, sprouts, insects, roots, cocoa, and coconuts.The Sun Bear does not hibernateAdult Sun Bears have almost no predators except humans,Possible predators include the leopard, the clouded leopard, and the Sun Bear's larger sympatric relative, the Asiatic Black Bear. The bear's loose skin on its neck allows it to wriggle its body inside its skin far enough to turn around and bite its attacker when grabbed.The Sun Bear does not hibernateAdult Sun Bears have almost no predators except humans,Possible predators include the leopard, the clouded leopard, and the Sun Bear's larger sympatric relative, the Asiatic Black Bear.[3] The bear's loose skin on its neck allows it to wriggle its body inside its skin far enough to turn around and bite its attacker when grabbed.

properties.name: Clouded Leopard
properties.description: The Clouded Leopard is found in southern China (at least as far north as Wuyi Shan), the eastern Himalayas, Nepal, north-east India, and mainland Southeast Asia.The animal is found only in Southeast Asia and ranges through southern China, the eastern Himalayas, northeast India, and southeast Asia.the clouded leopard is a carnivore. Its prey includes the sambar and muntjac deer, birds, bearded pigs, civet, monkeys, gibbons, squirrels, porcupines, fish, domestic cattle and chicken. Clouded Leopards that are held in captivity also eat eggs and some vegetation.The Clouded Leopard is a tree dweller,In captivity, the Clouded Leopard routinely hangs by its hind legs using its long tail for balance and runs head-first down tree trunks.The World Conservation Union estimates that fewer than 10,000 individuals exist, and warns that the population is declining.[2] Habitat loss due to widespread deforestation and hunting for use in Chinese medicinal preparations are thought to be causing populations of the Clouded Leopard to decline.Only six Clouded Leopards have ever been radio collared and their territorial movements monitored.Its prey includes the sambar and muntjac deer, birds, bearded pigs, civet, monkeys, gibbons, squirrels, porcupines, fish, domestic cattle and chicken. Clouded Leopards that are held in captivity also eat eggs and some vegetation.The Clouded Leopard is a tree dweller,In captivity, the Clouded Leopard routinely hangs by its hind legs using its long tail for balance and runs head-first down tree trunks.The World Conservation Union estimates that fewer than 10,000 individuals exist, and warns that the population is declining.[2] Habitat loss due to widespread deforestation and hunting for use in Chinese medicinal preparations are thought to be causing populations of the Clouded Leopard to decline.Only six Clouded Leopards have ever been radio collared and their territorial movements monitore.

properties.name: Bougainvillea
properties.description: Bougainvilleas are popular ornamental plants in most areas with warm climatesVarious species of Bougainvillea are the official flowers of the island of Grenada.It has many hooks so it can cling and hold onto other plants for support. The plant of bougainvillea is very abundant in the wild and is not endangered at all.

properties.name: Curare
properties.description: Some Indians of South America crush and cook the roots and stems, and add other plants and venomous animals, mixing it until it becomes a light syrup.The name comes from Indian word meaning "poison.'' Brazilians consider the root a diuretic, and use it internally in small quantities for madness and dropsy, and externally for bruises. It is also used for edema, fever, and kidney stones.

properties.name: Kapok Tree
properties.description: Kapoks are drought deciduous. This means they shed most or all of their leaves during the tropical dry season.In many places the straight trunks of the kapok tree are used to make dugout canoes. The white, fluffy seed covering is used in pillows and mattresses.

properties.name: Tualang Tree
properties.description: the wood is hard to cut and local people value the tualang for its honey. A standing tualang is more valuable for its honey than felled for its timber.Local people perform a ritual honey harvest with mixed Islamic and Hindu symbolism. Singers chant ancient prayers to cajole, charm and calm the bees.

properties.name: keystone species
properties.description: The fig tree is a successful forest species, with some 900 species of Ficus distributed around the world, thanks to its excellent means of dispersal (abundant, good-tasting fruit). The name strangler fig is used for a number of tropical vines that grow on other plants, often growing over other trees, strangling them, and eventually becoming trees themselves. Figs are considered a "keystone" species because they are so important to the animals of the rainforest. This is so because figs bear fruit several times a year.

properties.name: Endangered Species
properties.description: The King Cobra's biome is the Southeast Asian rain forest. The King Cobra forms a hood when it feels threatened. When threatened, it also raises up one third of its length and may sway toward you. The King Cobra is a carnivore that eats mainly other snakes, but will eat lizards, some frogs, and sometimes small mammals. Since the rainforest is being cut down, the King Cobra is put at risk.

properties.name: Probiscus Monkey
properties.description: The proboscis monkey is found only on the island of Borneo in Southeast Asia. Another obvious characteristic of proboscis monkeys are their large pot bellies. Proboscis monkeys are colobine monkeys and they have a unique digestive system that allows them to use leaves as their main food supply. The proboscis monkey's main predators are man and the clouded leopard. The proboscis monkeys were once protected by its mangrove habitat, which was unhabitable for people. It is listed as endangered by the USDI and Appendix 1 of CITES.

properties.name: Black Bear
properties.description: The black bear is the smallest of the three bear species found In North America. These bears have short non –retractable claws. The black bears fur is usually a uniform color but the muzzle is brown and can sometimes have light markings on their chests. The black bear is highly adaptable it can eat a variety of plants and animals. Its claws are used for climbing and killing prey. And hibernates thought the winter months.

properties.name: Roosevelt Elk
properties.description: The Roosevelt elk is the largest of the big game animals. They feed just after daylight and in the early evening. They prefer huckleberry, trailing wild blackberry, vine maple, salal, and other shrubs during the summer and for spring they eat weeds and grasses.    Although native to North America     it has adapted well to countries like New Zealand and Argentina. Male elk have large antlers, which are shed each year. These antlers are used for defense.

properties.name: Raccoon
properties.description: The raccoon has extremely sensitive front paws and facial mask. Studies show that they can remember solutions to tasks from 3 years ago. The raccoon is a secondary consumer in the food chain. Originally the raccoon inhabits the deciduous and mixed forests but to their adaptability they extended their range to mountainous areas. They sample their food and other objects with their paws. The most important sense to the raccoon is the sense of touch.

properties.name: Bobcat
properties.description: The bobcat has a gray to brown fur coat. The bobcat breeds from winter into spring. It resembles other species of the lynx. The bobcat is an adaptable predator that inhabits wooded areas. It prefers to eat rabbits and hare. The bobcat is a tertiary in the food chain.

properties.name: Black-tailed Deer
properties.description: The black-tailed deer is the smallest of the three native deer. It is also the darkest of the three. It gets its name because of its black tail. This animal thrives on the edge of the forest. It prefers to be in harsh weather.    The buck has antlers for defense. It browses western poison oak. It once ranged in Wyoming now common in northern California. And one way of escaping predators is that it can swim.

properties.name: Coastal Redwood
properties.description: The Coastal redwood is very thick. With quite soft fibrous is a bright red-brown when freshly exposed this is how it got its name. The leaf arrangement is spiral but the darker green leaves are twisted. I thought that this tree was important for the temperate rainforest. It is home to the threatened spotted owl and the California endangered marbled. Can be found in coastal California and southwestern Oregon.      Some adaptations are the twisted leaves are used to collect the most amount of sunlight. The seeds are in cones to help protect them. And they can reproduce sexually and asexually.

properties.name: Big Leaf Maple
properties.description: Big-leaf maple is used to make food. It is also used for lumber or to make dishes, pipes, and hooks. It leaves are deeply five-lobed. I picked this tree because it was a tree that was confined to the coastal strip on the Pacific Ocean. And the twigs and stems are browsed by deer and elk, clipped by beavers, and the roots attacked by nematodes. Can be found 33 to 51 N and 186 mi from the Pacific Ocean.       It can live in places were the soil is moist. The leaves stalk when broken oozes a milky substance. It has winged seeds to help spread out the seeds.

properties.name: Western Hemlock
properties.description: Western hemlock’s bark is brown thin and furrowed. The Western hemlock has a dark green above. And it has strongly dropping lead shoots. I picked this because it is an interesting plant.      This plant has cones to protect the trees. The shoots are very pale buff-brown, almost white. The stems are arranged spirally on the on the shoots.

properties.name: Douglas Fir
properties.description: Douglas fir has short needles. It also has egg shaped cones. This tree is not a true fir tree its needles are like fir trees but the cones are more like a spruce cone. I choose this tree because it was different. Can be found in the Pacific Northwest. The needles have a groove on the upper surface and have a pale waxy coating. The wood is strong this is a reason it is common in construction. The cones are used to protect the seeds.

properties.name: Sitka Spruce
properties.description: Sitka spruce is a conifer tree. Its bark is scaly and flakey. It is rare to find a tall Sitka spruce because of logging. It is a major importance in forestry, timber, and paper. Native tribes believed that it has magic powers. I picked it because I think it was an important tree. Can be found away from tidewater.          The cones of the Sitka spruce are used to protect the seeds. The needles have 2 white lines on both the upper and lower surfaces. The wood is light, strong, soft, and flexible.

properties.name: Spotted owl
properties.description: One endangered animal is the spotted owl. They can live for ten years. It has white feathers around the eyes going down. And lives in old growth forests around Canada to southern Oregon and Klamath region and California. They eat northern flying squirrel, rats, voles, birds, and shrews.     The greatest threat of the owl is the loss of old growth and mature late- seral forest. Another threat is that people are logging and killing the trees that the owls live in. The last threat is that the barred owl is invading Pacific Northwest

properties.name: Great Horned Owl
properties.description: One animal that I considered for my top 5 was the Great Horned Owl. One reason I would have choose it is because it has sharp claws to catch it’s prey. One reason I didn’t pick it is because it is adaptable and can be found in most parts of America.

properties.name: Landmarks and backround info
properties.description: One characteristic is the temperate rainforest sustain the highest levels of biomass than any other terrain. This means that there are a lot of trees that grow in the temperate rainforest. And being that is has mild winters and mild summers this means that the trees grow all year round. Also since there’s a high moisture content it is unlikely to have a wildfire.     Another characteristic is there is a abundance of epiphytes. They are dependent on the rainfall and high moisture levels. This is because they have no access to the soil water.

properties.name: How humans used it
properties.description: Humans have used the trees of the temperate rainforest for farming. The trees were cut down so there will be room for corps. Another reason is that farming gives us food and to make more farms we will have to cut some trees down.    The other thing is that they cut down trees to build for construction. Trees are a major part in construction. This is so we can build houses and other structures as well.

properties.name: keystone species
properties.description: The keystone species for this biome is salmon. Most salmon are born in fresh water and migrate to the ocean. But some rare species can only live in fresh water. They commonly have a parasite Henneguya salminicola in the flesh of the fish.    It is a keystone species because it is a major economic contributor to the world. It is also food to many animals like the black bear and many other animals. And if it would become extinct many animals would have a hard time living without it.

properties.name: Conservation
properties.description: There are a lot of conservations for the temperate rainforest. Some are Ecotrust, Alaska Rainforest Campaign, Southeast Alaska Conservation Council (SEACC), and Fundacion Senda Darwin. These are just some of the conservation efforts in the temperate rainforest.    They are all doing this for many reasons. One is they want to save the old growth trees of the temperate rainforest. Another is that they want to save the wildlife. There are many other reasons but as long as it works and the save the temperate rainforest I will be glad.

properties.name: Attractions
properties.description: In the temperate rainforest there are many attractions. One is the beach because the temperate rainforest is off the coast of the pacific. This is one attraction that not many people will want to miss out on.    Another attraction is that other people like to see mountains. Or if they are adventurerous they can climb the mountains. But if you are not a climbing person there is always other attractions like a national park.

properties.name: Agricultural
properties.description: The soils in the temperate rainforest are rich in nutrients.  This makes the trees grow large enough to block out sunlight. The result is the smaller plants to die and no other plant growth to accrue. Making a low unfertile soil for the temperate rainforest.     People are able to produce many different crops here. Because of the soil and the amount of rain there these crops can grow larger. This makes it a lot better crop than some others and is why they farm there.

properties.name: Dark Eyed Junco
properties.description: Another is the Dark eyed junco. One reason I would have choose it is that it lives in most of the temperate north American region. I didn’t choose it because I didn’t think it was that important for the top 5.

properties.name: backrounc info
properties.description: The temperate rainforest is usually near the ocean on coastal mountains. There are summer fogs to keep the forests cool and moist in the hot months. There is a high moisture content in the forest this is why it’s uncommon for wildfires. Also due to the high moisture epiphytes, including mosses are abundant.    The temperate rainforest receives more than 50-60 and sometimes can get up to 140 inches a year.  The climate in the region is comparable with winters rarely dropping below freezing, and summers seldom exceed 80 degrees. The temperate rainforest experiences mild wet winters and cool foggy or cloud covered summers. Due to mild winters this permits year round growth of the conifers and mild summers reduce the possibility of drought

properties.name: Marbled Murrelet
properties.description: Next is the marbled murrelet. It nests in old growth forests. It has a slender black bill, pointed wings and plumage. It closely resembles its relative the long billed murrelet. Breeding is very unusual unlike seabirds it doesn’t nest in colonies it nests on branches of mature conifers such as western hemlock, Sitka spruce, Douglas fir and coastal redwood. They eat mainly fish including pacific sand lance, pacific herring, and sea perch.    There are many threats to the marbled murrelet one is logging which is causing loss of nesting habitat. Another factor is high predation rates due to human disturbances. And last is climate-driven changes is now considered a factor.

properties.name: Prairie Dog
properties.description: The Prairie Dogs are very important animals in the biome.  They are on average about 14-17 inches when they stand up.  Their lifespan is from about 3-5 years.  The prairie dogs sleep during the day and they are very active during the early morning and evening.The prairie dog is very important the the other animals in the biome too because they help about 170 other speceis in the biome.  They are plant eaters and will not eat anymeat at all.  They are also very easy prey for the other animals http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Prairie.dog.600pix.jpg

properties.name: Buffalo
properties.description: The buffalo is a very important to the grassland biome. They eat a lot of the grass so that the grass doesn't grow too high in the. The buffalo travel in herds of 10 to 50. The buffalo is another name for the American Bison. They weigh anywhere from 800 pounds to 1,000 pounds. In the early 1800's people thought that the bison were extinct.http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:American_bison_k5680-1.jpg

properties.name: Ladybug
properties.description: The ladybug is very important to the biome.  One of the reasons is because there are  lot of farmers in the area and they eat all the little bug that eat plants.  The ladybugs are also easy prey for the other animals that are bigger.  Some of the farmers depend on their crops to live and the ladybugs help.  They actually dump the ladybugs in the fields to help the crops grow better

properties.name: Elk
properties.description: The elk are very important to the biome.  One of the reasons is because they travel in herds and keep the grass under control.  The baby calf animals are  also good prey for the coyotes and other meat eating animals. The elk mostly just eat the grass and plants.  These animals were once very extinct and now they moved them all over the world  and their population has gone back up again.  They are now hunted in the western part of the state.

properties.name: Coyote
properties.description: The coyote is one of the most important animals in the biome.  They hep contol the population by getting all the little animals and eating them for their pups.  They have about 6-12 pup per litter and only about half will make it past a month.  They eat any kind of little animals.  They grow to be about 4 feet long.  They are about 2 feet tall off of the ground when they are on all 4 legs

properties.name: Big Bluestem Grass
properties.description: This plant is very important in this biome.  Another name for this plant is Turkey Feet because of the shape of the seed heads.  It blooms from June through September.    Some adaptations of this plant is that it is 3 to 10 feet tall.  This type of grass is an important food for the American bison because it is the biggest type of grass that there is.  When farmers plow this plant there is nothing to keep the dirt from blowing away and this is part of the reason the dust bowl happened in the 1930’s

properties.name: Blue Grama Grass
properties.description: The nest plant is Blue Grama Grass and it is also very important plant in this biome.  This plant makes up 75% to 90% of the grasses found in the biome.  This grass is anywhere from 6 to 12 inches high.      When this plant is plowed it could take up to 50 years to grow back.  This plant is another reason that the dust bowl happened.  This plant can stand the heat, drought , and cold but it doesn’t like the shade.  Some people use this instead of regular grass because it helps prevent erosion and it is also really good for grazing animals.

properties.name: Buffalo Grass
properties.description: Buffalo grass is very important in this biome. This plant grows in all most every grassland biome all over the world.  This grass in small it only grows between 2 and 5 inches.    This grass is used to make some fake grass or turf.  This plant can catch on fire easy and it can help the biome because if it catches fire it will grow new plants for the animals too eat.  This is also a very good plant for bison traveling in heads because there is a lot of this grass and they can eat it while traveling.

properties.name: Indian Grass
properties.description: This plant is very important in this biome. It is know as a warm season grass. It will start in May and grow till July or August. This plant will grow from 5 to 12 inches high and ½ inches wide. This grass is grown in the grasslands but it can also be found in Europe and Africa. This grass is great for grazing meadows when its young.

properties.name: Stinging Nettle
properties.description: This plant is also very important in this biome. It can sting you if you touch it with your bare skin. It can grow up to 2 to 4 feet.

properties.name: Keystone Species
properties.description: Keystone species The keystone species in the grasslands would be the prairie dog. These animals are very difficult to breed. About five years ago people started to keep them as pets and they are very hard to take care of and they weren’t getting the right care and were dying. They are a very important prey for the black footed ferret, the swift fox, golden eagle, and the badger. All these animals that it is most important to ate endangered. There are many more animals that in is important to but those are the main ones. So now you should be able to see why many people say that this animal is a keystone species.

properties.name: Background Info
properties.description: Background info This biome is a mostly flat biome with a lot of grass and some colorful flowers. Another name for this biome is the prairie. In the whole world if you add up all the grasslands there will be about 1.4 million square miles. This biome has adapted very well to wild fires. The fires are a good thing because it lets the plants grow back and the animals like them when they are just starting to grow. This biome is in bad shape and we need to help it as much as we possibly can.

properties.name: landforms
properties.description: There aren’t too many landforms in this biome because it is so flat but there are some so we will name them. There are many lakes and wetlands in this biome. There are also many rivers in this biome. The rivers flow off of the mountains in the Rockies and eventually get too the grasslands. They don’t get much rain in the biome and It is always dry so they have some fires. And they also have some tornadoes because it is so flat.

properties.name: Human Activity
properties.description: From the 1930’s until 10 years farmers have made up 50% of the population. But now it has dropped to 10% and that is a major problem. With not as many farmers plowing and some people are worried that there might be another dust bowl. There is a variety of crops grown in the biome. And many people aren’t farming because of the economic struggle they are moving into the city. Also there are some fuels that we could get from the grasslands but we don’t drill for them.

properties.name: Tourist Attractions
properties.description: If you like the old western movies and are interested in that kind of stuff then this area is the perfect area for you to visit. North Dakota is one of the oldest western tourist states. If you’re a farmer and want to go out west you would want too go to Iowa. They are know as the corn state producing over $10 million in crops and livestock yearly. If you want to go out west and are interested in the civil war then Kansas is a good place for you to visit. They also have the worlds largest ball of twine in Cawker City. If you would like to see the Oregon trail Nebraska would be a good place for you to visit. And if your into art they have one of the largest are museums in the world.

properties.name: Agriculture
properties.description: There is a lot of agriculture in this biome. There is a lot of farmlands in this biome that grow many different crops like corn and other crops. The grassland is very important to this country because of all the crops and animals that they grow and raise. There are many cultivated forage crops in this biome. There is also the most square pasture miles in this biome than any other biome in the world. Many of the pastures in the biome aren’t owned by one person they are owned by the state.

properties.name: Northern Swift Fox
properties.description: Northern Swift Fox The Northern Swift Fox has been hanging on by a little bit for many years now but they are getting worse. They have been being illegally killed by hunters and farmers so they are getting worse. Their diet consists of small mammals, insects, and grass. The northern swift fox has been around for a while now and would be greatly missed if they go extinct. They are the smallest fox that we know of. They usually have about 5 pups per liter and not all of them survive most of the time.

properties.name: Black Footed Ferret
properties.description: These animals are very rare and it’s hard to tell how many of them there are because they come out at night and we can’t get an exact number of how many there are. They are members of the weasel family. Their diet consists of prairie dogs and another cool thing about these animals is that they live in the burrows of their prey. They are predators too the smaller animals.

properties.name: Water boatman
properties.description: The first animal that I have chose for my top 5 animals is the water boatman. Some characteristics of the water boatman is it goes under the water to search for its food which is algae and some minute aquatic organisms. This type of insect is mostly found in or around water.Some adaptations of the water boatman that allows it to go under water for search of their food are, they sometimes frequently carry an air bubble on the surface of their body or maybe even under their wings. That is whay they draw their oxygen from when they are under water. I chose this animals because if we didn't have any animals that ate the algae then there would be lots of bulid up on the rocks and other surfaces and, that could cause the water to be dirty and polluted which can harm other animals in the water.

properties.name: Water Boatman
properties.description: The first animal that I have chose for my top 5 animals is the water boatman. Some characteristics of the water boatman is it goes under the water to search for its food which is algae and some minute aquatic organisms. This type of insect is mostly found in or around water.Some adaptations of the water boatman that allows it to go under water for search of their food are, they sometimes frequently carry an air bubble on the surface of their body or maybe even under their wings. That is whay they draw their oxygen from when they are under water. I chose this animals because if we didn't have any animals that ate the algae then there would be lots of bulid up on the rocks and other surfaces and, that could cause the water to be dirty and polluted which can harm other animals in the water.

properties.name: Aquatic Insects
properties.description: The second animal that I have chose is aquatic insects. Aquatic insects are invertebraes and are a part of the group called arthropods. They are mostly not seen unless you discover, a pond, lakes, ditches, and streams. The aquatic insects that live on the land breathe through holes in thier bodies called spiracle. They eat all dead and alive organic material that is in the water.They can eat the algae and other materials off the rocks under the water. They can do so because, they have special mouthparts that remove algae that is growing on these several surfaces, Also they can even shred pieces off to eat.

properties.name: Mayfly
properties.description: The third animal that is on my top 5 is the Mayfly. The mayfly eats about the same thing that an aquatic insect does the algae and debris that accumulates on rocks or other substrates in streams. Adult mayflies mate during the night in swarms in the air because they only live one to two nights.Some adaptations that allows the mayfly to be able to fly in the air is its large triangular shaped wings in the front that has many crossed veins with the wings held upright and together over the thorax. The mayfly nymph has gills which allow them to breathe under the water.

properties.name: Blackfly
properties.description: The fourth animal that is on my top 5 is the, Black fly. The black fly, is any member of the family simuilldae. Most black fly's gain there nourishment by sucking blood of several different animals. The Black fly can spread a disease called river blindness.I chose the black fly because it is good to know what animals could carry deadly diseases or just diseases. They get their full amount of nourishment by the foldable fans that they have around their mouth, these fans catch the passing debris. Most black flies depend on lotic habitats to bring them their food.

properties.name: trout
properties.description: The fifth animal that I have chose for my top five is, trout. Most trout live in clear and cool temperature water. Sunlight can penetrate to the streambed which helps the growth and food for the trout by the clear water. They also like to live in any pond, lake, or river that is calm.I chose the trout because it seemed like a good animal to chose, because it can not really harm anybody in any kind of way. It also helps people in the freswater and stream biome if you actually think about it. If there was no fish in the water for people to catch then take home and cook for their family how would they support their families for food wise.

properties.name: Diatoms Algae
properties.description: The first plant  that I have chose for my top five plants is Diatoms Algae. Diatoms Algae is unicellular orhanisms that is the kingdom protista. Most of these diatoms exist singly even though some join to form colonies.This type of algae is mostly found in freshwater and saltwater, in moist soil, and also on the moist surface of plants. Diatoms may and can occur in a more compact form that is soft, chalky, and lightweighted rock which is called diatomite. Diatoms have deposited most of the earth's limestone.

properties.name: Hornworts
properties.description: The second plant that I have chose to be on my top five is, Hornworts which is a type of moss. Hornworts is non-vascular plants that is in the bryophyte group.Hornworts can be found world-wide but they tend to grow in places that are damp or humid. Some of them may grow in large numbers in the soil of gardens and cultivated fields as tiny weeds. The life of a hornwort starts form a haploid spore

properties.name: Rimu Seaweed
properties.description: The third plant that I have choosen is rimu which is a green seaweed. Rimu green seaweed is usually found in shallow water with plenty of sunlight. This type of seaweed is edible.Sea rimu grows on running root. The leaves of this plant looks like a bit of the rimu tree. It is also normally grazed down to a short carpet.http://www.seafriends.org.nz/enviro/habitat/rsgreen.htm#green

properties.name: Watercress
properties.description: The fourth plant that I have chosen is watercress, this is a fast growing plant. They are a member of the family Brassicaceae or cabbage. This plant produces small white and green fowers in clusters. There are many fibrous roots on this plant. The veins are parallel and the flower parts in three ways. There is bundles of stem vascular tissue scattered throughout the stem.http://1.bp.blogspot.com/_jZUWvmNMHtA/Sbjwxbot4JI/AAAAAAAAAMY/0-pKzJtUD2U/s400/watercress.jpg

properties.name: nymphaea
properties.description: The fifth animal that I have chose for my top five plants is, nymphaea alba. Which is a species of water lillies are usually found in marshes, slow moving streams,ponds, lakes, and canals.  It perfers to have light, medium or heavy soils. In order for this plant to grow it needs sunlight it can not be in the shade and excepted to grow. It can also grow in water.

properties.name: Manatees endangered
properties.description: One endangered animal in the freshwater and stream biome is, Manatees. Manatees are mainly herbivores. They are also sometimes known as sea cows.Manatees are endangered because, they can be struck with boats or slashed with propellers since they live in coastal estuarine waters. Some natural perdators of the manatee is sharks, crocodiles, orcas, and alligators

properties.name: Algae Keystone Species
properties.description: The keystone species that I think is best in the freshwater and strem biome is, algae. Algae, is a large and diverse group of simple typically autotrophic organisms. They range from unicellular to multicellular forms.  Alge is a keystone species because without algae the fish in the water can't eat. If the fish don't eat then the animals that live near the streams and rivers can't eat because if the fish does not get to eat then the population of them will decrease. And eventually all the animal population will decrease and there will be barley any animals left surviving in the area.

properties.name: Paretroplus menarambo extinct
properties.description: An animal that is extinct is the paretroplus menarambo. The paretrplus menarambo was a species of fish in the chichlidae family. The river was its natural habitat. The Paretroplus menarambo became extinct because of the loss of its habitat. This animal needs rivers to live in and when the amount of rivers started to decrease the amount of paretroplus menarambo did as well.

properties.name: Background info.
properties.description: Some background information on freshwaetrer and stream biome is, there is different types of water sources and some shady and sunny parts in the biome. There is many different types of animals that live there that need different climates to survive so there has to be different weahter every now and then for those animals to survive. There is many different types of freshwater regions such as ponds and lakes, streams and rivers. The temperature of ponds and lake mostly vary from as low as 4 degrees celsius near the bottom and as high as 22 degrees celsius on the top and that is during the summer. In the wintertime ponds and lakes temperatures range anywhere from 4 degrees celsius at the bottom and 0 degrees celsius on the top which is ice.

properties.name: landforms
properties.description: The landforms of the freshwater and stream biome are as follows. Not all streams and rivers form the same way in the same kind of places. Some of their headwaters may be springs, snowmelt or even some lakes. Some streams and rivers may occur in the woods but others may occur where there are plains and grasss.             The freswater and stream biome is used for human use because their medium water is a major natural resource. Water is the basis the basis of life, it helps support life and some species live in it for the most part of their lives. The water from this biome supports humans with drinking water and also water for crop irrigation. Without water from this region there would be no way to water the crops and farmers would not be able to make a living because they would not be able to produce any crops to sell and/or grow any for themselves. That is why the freshwater and stream biome is so importatnt in human use of life

properties.name: Argiculture
properties.description: Argiculture of the freshwater and stream biome is, livestock that is raised in these rivers and streams such as fish. Livestock is the biggest agriculture thing in the freshwater and stream biome but some other things is crops and farming. There are some things that are grown there that can be used as crops for some people such as certain kinds of grasses and seeds. There is really no farming that needs to be done in this biome unless, some one would have a stream or river by their house and want to plant things around it then there would be maintence needed

properties.name: Tourist attractions
properties.description: Some tourist attractions to the freshwater and stream biome are camps, parks, and maybe some houses that are built by the rvers and streams. These are tourist attractions because rivers and streams are used by humans in many ways such as drinking water and maybe for some people to swim in. Many people that go on camping trips by the water might like to go for a nice swim in the stream/river or pond/lake.

properties.name: conservation
properties.description: The conservation of the freshwater and stream biome is, when the biome restores its wildlife and other natural sources such as, soil, forest, and waters. It restores itself after some and/or many physical changes. These changes may change the biome but the conservation of the animals can make it be the same as before.

properties.name: Other animal choices
properties.description: Some other animals that I have considered to be on my top five are, maybe some more animals that actually live in the water such as other types of fish and/or different types of frogs.

properties.name: Red shoulder hawk
properties.description: I chose the Red-shouldered hawk as one of my animals because without it the rabbits, squirrels, mice, rats, and chipmunks will increase. The Red-shouldered hawk can be found in a mature deciduous or mixed deciduous-conifer forest and swamps. It builds its nest 20 to 60 ft above the forest floor. It likes to perch on a dead tree so it can watch the forest floor for animals. The red-shouldered hawk doesn’t’ have a special adaptations needed to survive in the northern winter months. The hawk flies down to the northern part Mexico for the winter. Its talons help it grip its prey and help it stay on the tree branches.

properties.name: American Beaver
properties.description: I chose the Beaver, as an important animal because the dams help restore wetlands. The dams are beneficial because it helps flood control. The Beaver will build their lodges on an island, banks on a pond, and shores of lakes. The lodge is built with sticks, grass, and moss, woven together and plastered with mud. To ensure the right water depth the beavers will dam streams with logs, branches, mud, and stones.    The beaver’s adaptation is its tail. When the beaver is in danger, it slaps its tail to warn other beavers. The beaver’s coat helps keep it warm because of two layers. The top layer is long, shiny guard hairs to protect it from predators and the second layer is thick and woolly with short fur.

properties.name: Barred Owl
properties.description: I chose the Barred owl because it also keeps the squirrels, field mice, and chipmunks population down. The Barred owl can be found in coniferous forest near water source, and wooded swamps. They require dense foliage for roosting during the daytime, and large trees with holes for nesting. They will hunt in open areas if needed to.    The adaptation of the barred owl is asymmetrical hearing for homing in on their prey. Their feathers appear to be ragged but their coloring is camouflage and their ragged shape silences movement so they can fly without being heard. The outer toe is reversible to allow better grip on trees and prey.

properties.name: Mink
properties.description: I chose the Mink because it preys on fish and other aquatic life. They also prey on waterfowl. The Mink can be found in forested areas that are near a water source. Streams, ponds, and lakes, with some sort of brushy or rocky cover nearby are optimal territory. Mink’s are mainly an aquatic mammal.    The mink’s adaptation’s to survive in the wild is its speed and quickness to sneak up on prey. It can close its eyes and ears when swimming for food. Their webbed feet make them excellent swimmers when they are finding food in the water.

properties.name: North American river otter
properties.description: I chose the River otter because it helps keep some of the fish population down. Also it eats some birds, small mammals, and some aquatic plants. The River otter can be found anywhere there is permanent food and easy access to water. They live in fresh water and marine habitats, which includes rivers, lakes, marshes, swamps, and estuaries.    The River otter’s adaptations are when they swim their ears and nose close up so no water can get in. When they dive they’re heart rate decreases by a tenth of their normal heart rate which they can conserve oxygen. They are excellent swimmers with a powerful tail and webbed feet.

properties.name: Big Leaf Maple
properties.description: I chose the Big Leaf Maple because it is home to many birds and insects. The leave’s provides many nutrients to the forest floor. The sap of the Big Leaf Maple provides food for the deer and birds.    The adaptations of the Big Leaf Maple it can live in dry to moist places. It can grow the best near borders of foothills, low mountain streams, and in alluvial river bottoms. The maple is extremely flood resistant species.

properties.name: Coast Redwood
properties.description: I chose the Coast Redwood because it provides homes for the threatened Spotted Owl, California–endangered Marbled Murrelet. Also provides home for other birds, mammals, reptiles, and amphibians. The Coast Redwood can live over 600 years old and taller than 380 feet.    The adaptation of the Coast redwood is it can get water from the fog. Its thick, tannin-rich bark helps it from fires and insect damaged. The bark provides protection and insulation for the tree.

properties.name: Valley Oak
properties.description: I chose the Valley Oak because it provides homes for the common grey squirrel and acorn woodpecker. The tree can tolerate cool wet winter to hot dry summers, but requires a lot of water. It can be found in rich deep soils on valley floors 600 m below elevation.

properties.name: Thimbleberry
properties.description: I chose the Thimbleberry Tree because it provides food for the animals. Its berries will make an excellent jam. The thimbleberry leaves can make a handy “toilet paper” because they’re large, soft and non-irritating.    The adaptations the thimbleberry is it can grow in a wide variety of sites from moist to dry climates. It is considered moderately shade tolerant.

properties.name: Posion Ivy
properties.description: I chose the Poison Ivy plant because it can grow in places where seasonal flooding occurs. The plants leaves have almond shape. Most of the time the plant can be found in wooded areas. The plants can also grow up the base of a tree like a vine. The best way of getting rid of poison ivy is a goat because a goat can eat poison ivy without getting sick. Here are a few animals that eat poison ivy: White-tailed deer, Wild Turkey, American Robin, Gray Catbird, Eastern Cottontail, Dark-eyed Junco, and the European Starling.    The adaptations of poison ivy is when something is brushed up against it, it releases epidermis.

properties.name: Willow Flycatcher
properties.description: The Willow flycatcher inhabitant’s deciduous thickets, especially willows and near water. They catch insects in flight and sometimes picking insects from foliage while hovering. They also eat some berries. Their nest are cupped shaped in a fork of a shrubs or trees. Flycatchers migrate south to Mexico and Central America, often selecting winter habitat near water.    This bird is endangered because poachers are shooting, killing, harassing, trapping or collecting. Livestock grazing, dams, water withdrawal, and sprawl have taken the sentinel-like songbird of more than 90% of its riparian habitat and more vulnerable to others bird eating their eggs and using their nests to incubate their own eggs.

properties.name: Brush Rabbit
properties.description: The Brush Rabbit inhabitants the understory shrub layer of the riparian ecosystem and its the primal habitat for the rabbit. They must have small clearings for the rabbit to bask in the sun and feed on a variety of vegetation. Rabbits live in tunnels of vines and shrubs of low growing mats.    The rabbits ecosystem and habitat ha reduced by 90% because of urban, commercial, and agricultural development, wood cutting, reclamation and flood control activities, groundwater pumping, river channelization, dam construction, and water diversions. The floods have destroyed half of the foliage and habitat. Hunting has also played a part in the reduction of the rabbits. When flooding occurs, foraging habitat and shelter are eliminated within the levees.

properties.name: Floodplain
properties.description: The landforms in the riparian include floodplains, terraces, and connecting hill slopes. The landform classification is based on topographic characteristics, position relative to the stream channel, and estimated flood frequency. The floodplain landforms were characteristics by the disturbances of the timber harvests, and ongoing fluvial disturbances.    Terraces and hill slopes were found to have higher conifer tree abundance, but younger trees were higher on the hill slopes. Deciduous tree reproduction was very low on terraces and hill slopes. The terraces and hill slopes landforms were also subject to timber harvest as the stand initiating agent but were unaffected.

properties.name: Terraces/hillslopes
properties.description: The landforms in the riparian include floodplains, terraces, and connecting hill slopes. The landform classification is based on topographic characteristics, position relative to the stream channel, and estimated flood frequency. The floodplain landforms were characteristics by the disturbances of the timber harvests, and ongoing fluvial disturbances.    Terraces and hill slopes were found to have higher conifer tree abundance, but younger trees were higher on the hill slopes. Deciduous tree reproduction was very low on terraces and hill slopes. The terraces and hill slopes landforms were also subject to timber harvest as the stand initiating agent but were unaffected.

properties.name: Pacific Salmon
properties.description: The Pacific Salmon is an anadromous because it is born in fresh water then migrates to the ocean, than it migrates back to where it was born to reproduce. Once the female salmon lays her eggs, then she swims off and dies. The Pacific Salmon is a Keystone species because majority economical contributor to the world. It’s food to many other animals including humans. If it would go extinct the whole world would parish because it’s food and work for many people.

properties.name: Wetlands
properties.description: Properly functioning wetlands and riparian areas provide critical habitat for waterfowl, freshwater fish, wildlife, and migratory birds. It is the relative abundance of this wildlife, water and other natural resources that is valued by the communities of the Gallatin Valley, Montana and the newcom- ers attracted to it.

properties.name: Riparian Buffer
properties.description: A riparian buffer is a vegetated area near a stream, usually forested, which helps shade and partially protects a stream from the impact of adjacent land uses. It plays a key role in increasing water quality in associated streams, rivers, and lakes, thus providing environmental benefits. With the decline of many aquatic ecosystems due to agricultural production, riparian buffers have become a very common conservation practice aimed at increasing water quality and reducing pollution.Riparian buffers act to intercept sediment, nutrients, pesticides, and other materials in surface runoff and reduce nutrients and other pollutants in shallow subsurface water flow. They also serve to provide habitat and wildlife corridors in primarily agricultural areas. They can also be key in reducing erosion by providing stream bank stabilization.

properties.name: Logging
properties.description: The protection of riparian zones is often a consideration in logging operations. The undisturbed soil, soil cover, and vegetation provide shade, leaf litter, woody material, and reduce the delivery of soil eroded from the harvested area. Factors such as soil types and root structures, climatic conditions and above ground vegetative cover impact the effectiveness of riparian buffering.

properties.name: White Tailed Deer
properties.description: White-tailed Deer have a four-chambered stomach, which allows them to change their diet throughout the year. The bacterium allows them to eat a variety of foods; from which they have little to choose from during the winter months and such. White-tailed Deer also grow antlers, which fall off in the spring. While there fawns are youngSome adaptations of the deer are that the deer can alert other deer if they think something is wrong. They do this by lifting their tails like a signal or white flag. They have good hearing and good eyesight. With their sharp antlers and hooves a male adult deer cold kill a wolf. Also to prepare of winter the deer may gather in small herds to protect themselves. They will also grow a thick coat and eat a lot to store body fat for long winters. These are some reasons why I chose the deer as one of my top 5 animals because it will control vegetation.http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/White-tailed_deer

properties.name: Beaver
properties.description: The beaver is a semi aquatic rodent species the second largest to the capybara. It controls water flow by building dams. These dams create deep, safe, still water that keeps them safe from predators. It is being poached for its fur. Its lethal tail is used for swimming.Some adaptations of the beaver are that they alert other beavers when something is wrong by hitting the water. They also can eat under water they do this by closing their lips behind their teeth so that they can gnaw underwater. Their coats are waterproof. They have underwater vision, which enables them to see underwater. Their tail also acts like a rudder allowing them to swim fast. I chose the beaver as one of my top 5 animals because it controls waterway systems and controls dead trees population.http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beaver

properties.name: Squrriel
properties.description: Squirrels eat mostly nuts, seeds, conifer cones, fruits, fungi, and green vegetation. They also eat meat when faced with hunger.The Squirrel unlike rabbits or deer cannot digest cellulose and must rely on foods rich in protein, carbohydrates, and fat. They bury their food sources bellow the ground or in trees. Their keen sense of smell allows them to be able to find the food source again. I chose the squirrel as one of my top 5 animals because it is very versatile in which it can eat a variety of food.http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Squirrel

properties.name: Dhole
properties.description: The Dhole eats Chital fawns and Indian Hares, while a pair or trio of Dholes suffices to kill a medium sized ungulates such as deer in 2 minutes. It consumes the heart, liver, eyeballs, rump and fetus first.The diurnal hunter though it does hunt at night as well. It hunts by scent. Disemboweling and eating the prey while it is still alive. The Dhole can eat up to 8.8 pounds of meat in an hour. (Will compete over kills) I chose the Dhole as one of my top 5 animals because it is an endangered species that we could learn more about. Even though it is very close to the domestic dog, it might benefit us someway in the future. Whether it is through mixing breeds to help cure a canine disease or to save a dying breed.http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dhole

properties.name: Coyote
properties.description: The coyote is a versatile carnivore with a 90% mammalian diet, depending on the season. Eating voles, eastern cottontails, ground squirrels, and mice. Prefer fresh meat; have been known to eat human rubbish and domestic pets. Coyotes are persistent hunters, with successful attacks sometimes lasting from 14 minutes to 21 hours.The coyote shifts its hunting techniques according to the prey it is stalking. Such as small animals it will stalk slowing in the tall grass and use its acute sense of smell to track down the prey. It then stiffens and pounces like a cat. Coyotes commonly work in teams when hunting to avoid exhaustion. When attacking a bigger animal they go for the back and the flanks of their prey. Also they might grab the neck and head and pull it down to the ground. I chose the Coyote as one of my top 5 because it controls a lot of smaller animals population, which if they weren’t controlled would affect this biome.http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coyote

properties.name: Lady Fern
properties.description: The Lady Fern is a deciduous perennial fern. The fronds of the fern are cut twice and grow from a central base. The J-shaped spore casings, or sori, grow on the under side of the leaf. Lady Ferns like shaped areas growing usually in the understory of other trees.The Lady Fern was used by Native Americans to treat urination problems and to easy pains from child birth and breast pain from child birth.http://www.blueplanetbiomes.org/lady_fern.htm

properties.name: White Birch
properties.description: The White Birch can be identified by it's easy peeled white bark and narrow horizontal stripes. The bark is used as a fire starter because it burns even when wet.Strong flexible wood allows it to be made into things such as canoes, spears, bows, arrows, and snow shoes. It's sap provides syrup, wine, beer, and medicinal tonics. It prefers colder climates.http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/White_birch

properties.name: Common Lime
properties.description: The Common Lime is also known as the Linded TreeThe leaves are rounded slightly heart-shaped. The color is a dull dark green. The tops of the leaves are hairless but have tufts of white hairs at the junction of the viens. The flowers of the Common Lime are yellowish to dull white in color and sweetly sented. A small nutlet sized fruit comes from the Common Lime about the size of a pea. Hairy and faintlyribbed together they hang until they float away in the fall. The bark is dull grey when young but as it grows it darkens into brown with some apparent shallow cracksThe bass or bast is the inner bark which is used for mats, ropes, and fancy baskets. The wood is white and cannot be eaten by worms. Can be used for small furniture but isn't very strong.http://www.blueplanetbiomes.org/deciduous_plant_page.htm

properties.name: Pecan Tree
properties.description: The Pecan Tree nuts are a main food source for Native Americans living in the South West. They would store these nuts and save them for over the winter. Likes humid climates.This tree is mainly used for it's wood to be made into benches, cabinets, stools, chairs, and other useful supplies. It provides 250,000,000 lbs. of pecans a year. It's a perennial tree. It has a shallow root system with with flowers that hang down like tassels. They use the wind to self pollinate.http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pecan_tree

properties.name: Guelder Rose
properties.description: The Guelder Rose is a deciduous shrub and member of the honey suckle family. The flowers on this shrub provide nectar for insects. In Canada it's berries are an important food source for local birds and other animals instead of cranberries.The Guelder Rose bark was used for an asthma treatment and to treat cramps. It's berries can also be used to make ink. It's an invasive shrub making it not threatened or endangered.http://www.blueplanetbiomes.org/deciduous_plant_page.htm

properties.name: Bald Eagle
properties.description: My first endangered animal is the Bald Eagle. The Bald Eagle is not only our Nation's bird but also a symbol of peace. The Bald Eagle was classified as endangered during the late 20th century and regained strength and returned to threatened on July 12, 1995. Due to thinning of eggshells from pesticides reproduction has been low.The DDT, Dichloro-Diphenyl-Trichloroethane has made birds sterile or unable to lay healthy eggs. In the 1950's their were only 412 pairs of breeding adults in the 48 states. In 1984 the National Wildlife Federation said that hunting, power line electrocution, and collisions while flying were the main causes as Eagles' deaths. Also effecting these birds is oil, lead, mercury pollution, and by humans and predator intrusion. The 1918 Migratory Bird Treaty protects the Eagle in Canada and the United States. Since DDT has been banned since 1989 the birds population has returned to normal and has been moved to least concern.http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bald_eagle

properties.name: Dire Wolf
properties.description: The Dire Wolf is an extinct carnivore that lived in the North and South Americas. Much like a dog, but slower. This animal died out because the larger mammals it ate died out.Since it was slower it couldn't catch the food that the red or gray wolf could catch. Skeletons have been found all over North America including Ohio and Indiana. There were over 3,600 found in tar pits in California. Showing that like other wolves that they most likely hunted in packs.http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dire_wolf

properties.name: White Tailed Deer
properties.description: White-tailed Deer have a four-chambered stomach, which allows them to change their diet throughout the year. The bacterium allows them to eat a variety of foods; from which they have little to choose from during the winter months and such. White-tailed Deer also grow antlers, which fall off in the spring. While there fawns are youngSome adaptations of the deer are that the deer can alert other deer if they think something is wrong. They do this by lifting their tails like a signal or white flag. They have good hearing and good eyesight. With their sharp antlers and hooves a male adult deer cold kill a wolf. Also to prepare of winter the deer may gather in small herds to protect themselves. They will also grow a thick coat and eat a lot to store body fat for long winters. These are some reasons why I chose the deer as one of my top 5 animals because it will control vegetation.http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/White-tailed_deer

properties.name: Background & Climate
properties.description: Some background information about the Deciduous Forest is that the trees lose their leaves every year in the fall. Also the Temperate Deciduous Forest can be found on almost every continent. The animals that live in this biome have unique adaptations allowing them to live their seasonal lives. Some examples are bears they store up fat and such to be able to hibernate through the though winters. And most birds fly south. The Climate in the Deciduous Forest is very diverse changing with each season. Also changing with the season is the nature around it. From plants blooming in the Spring to their leaves falling off in the Fall. The climate affects everything. But the summers average mildly around 70 degrees F and the winters also mild average around alittle below freezing. The Deciduous biome has 14 inches of rain in the winter and about 17 inches of rain in the summer.http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Season

properties.name: Appalachian Mountians
properties.description: An example of a unique landform or characteristic is the Appalachian Mountain Range. The Appalachian Mountains are located in the Deciduous Forest. They are a mountain range that vast from 100-300 miles wide and are 1,500 miles long. The Mountain range is divided into 7 different parts the Northern Appalachians (New England), Appalachian Plateau, Valley & Ridge, Blue Ridge Mountains, Piedmont, Coastal Plain, “Crystalline Appalachians”, Central Appalachians’ (Atlantic States)The climate in this mountain range varies from state to state: including cold mild winters in the south to extremely cold dangerous winters in the North. Some spots on the range have noted to have over 100 inches of snowfall each year. But the elevation really depends on the climate.http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Appalachian_mountains

properties.name: Human Destruction
properties.description: Some examples of human destruction would be that people and companies are cutting down trees for building Hotel’s and roadways. Less than a quarter of the original forests are left. This is a result of humans harvesting the wood for timber. Global Warming is also a result of these trees being cut down.While destroying huge forests in the process these forests are shelter/protection for the animals living in this biome. Humans are also dumping waste into their habitat, which can kill or even mutate the animals.http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Forest_fires

properties.name: Tourists Attraction
properties.description: Niagara Falls is located in the Northern Deciduous Forest. It is a huge tourists attraction. Containing two waterfalls over 28 million visitors come each year. It was naturally made by the rivers located above the fallshttp://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Niagra_falls

properties.name: Conservation Efforts
properties.description: After a fire here at Cook Forest State Park they have been making great efforts to plant trees to try to repopulate it.http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cook_Forest_State_Park

properties.name: Clown Fish
properties.description: My first animal would be a clownfish. I would pick this animal to keep because they are omnivorous. They can eat both meat and plant. In the wild they eat algae, mollusks, plankton, ect. In captive they can eat fish flakes, fish food, ect. They also lay hundreds of eggs at one time. So there is a good chance some of they will survive. They are also protandrous hermaphrodites, which means that when the female dies the male becomes the female. That means they can change their sex so there will always be a male and a female to survive. Clownfish mostly line in the Pacific and Indian Oceans. They are found around Australia, Southeast Asia, Japan, and Indo-Malaysian region. They are not found in the Caribbean. They only live in ten% of the thousands of sea anemones. The clownfish are capable of adapting to captivity as long as they have what they need to survive. In the wild they live between the Tropic of Cancer and the Tropic of Capricorn. They may be able to survive in other places if the water is warm; there is plants, coral, or anemones they can live in. Also a good food source and the water is shallow.

properties.name: Lobster
properties.description: The second animal I would pick is the lobster. I would pick the lobster because it is able to survive just about anywhere. They eat just about anything it can get. They mostly like live fish but will scavenge if they have to. They may also resort to cannibalism if they have to.The second animal I would pick is the lobster. I would pick the lobster because it is able to survive just about anywhere. They eat just about anything it can get. They mostly like live fish but will scavenge if they have to. They may also resort to cannibalism if they have to.

properties.name: Sponge
properties.description: My third pick would be a sponge. Most people think that sponges are plants but they are wrong. They are animals that have survived over a long period of time. They were around when the dinosaurs were. They are not hard to keep around because they can force feed. They belong to a group called porifera. They are made of simple aggregations of cells. There are many kinds of sponges. Most types of sponges can live in warm, shallow water. They need currents and water movement to get the water to go through them so they can get the nutrients out of it. They can also survive in captivity as long as it has nutrients in the water. Other than some of those little difficulties they can survive like the clownfish and the lobster.

properties.name: Blue Tang Fish
properties.description: My fourth pick would be the blue tang fish. They are in the family of ssurgeonfishes, and unicornfishes. They live in tropical seas around coral reefs. They also have spines (one or more) on each side of their tail. They eat algae, so these would keep the algae population down. They take protection from other animals that may try to eat it in seaweed, sea grass, coral reefs ect.       Some of the adaption’s the blue tang fish has is that it can survive in marine aquariums. They can also survive in other places in the ocean but has to have shallow, warmer water to survive. They also need algae to survive seeming how that is about all it eats.

properties.name: Blacktip Reef Shark
properties.description: My final pick would be a blacktip reef shark. They eat just about any animal and may even eat a dead animal off the sea floor if it is not to deep and was fresh. They also belong to the carcharhinus melanopterus. Which means it is a tropical shark that lives in warm temperate seas.     Some of the adaption’s of the blacktip reef shark is that it many be able to survive in other places. It can survive in other places in the ocean but most likes shallow, warm water next to a good food source (like the coral reef). They may be able to adapt to captivity but you would need many fish to feed it and a big fish bowl.

properties.name: Padina
properties.description: My first plant I pick would be the Padina. It is a very common plant in the coral reefs. The padina is a group of brown algae with leafy, fan-like blades. They mostly live on hard substrates like rocks in shallow water. They lay down calcium carbonate on the cell wall surface rather than between the cells (intercellularly).     The padina live on rocks, coral reefs, anything hard that may support it. They mostly live in shallow warm water near or in the coral reefs. They can live in captivity as long as it has rocks or something to attach to.

properties.name: Cymopolia
properties.description: My second plant I would pick would be the Cymopolia. I would pick this plant because it is common in most coral reefs zones. They are green algae that cover most rock or any other hard surface. I would also pick this because the end of the stems are covered with calcium carbonate that is the same chemical that coral skeletons is made of. That means if we don’t even save the coral reefs and we don’t kill the cymopolia. That over hundreds of years that the coral reefs may come back.     They are commonly found in shallow water. They have to live in shallow, warm water like the tropical zone. They also need rocks and objects to live on. They could survive in captivity and don’t need really any care.

properties.name: Turtle Grass
properties.description: My third plant would be Turtle Grass. It is found around the world and is home to many marine animals. Some animals also eat it. Recently scientific workings have found that many species eat it. Some of the species are dugongs, fish manatees, and crabs. Even geese and swans have been found to eat turtle grass. It also provides protection for smaller things that many be eaten. Turtle Grass also helps to keep sediments down. The roots stabilize the seabed and the leaves slow down water-currents.     Turtle Grass is found all over the world. It forms mostly in sandy or muddy (soft ground) on the seafloor. It is found up to 40ft in depth. Mostly is found in the coral reef ecosystems and in the photic zone. The water has to be kind of clear because it uses photosynthesize to survive. They life cycle is entirely underwater.

properties.name: Codium Edule
properties.description: My fourth plant I would pick would be the Codium edule. This plant is a Blue-Green Algae. It forms a spongy mass of many intertwined dark green cylindrical branches. This plant use photosynthetic micro-organisms to survive. These micro-organisms are a significant component to the marine nitrogen cycle. It is also an important primary producer in many areas of the ocean.     Blue-Green algae live in many places. It lives all over the ocean and even can occur in both freshwater and hypersaline inland lakes. That’s why I would pick this plant. It can survive in both freshwater and the ocean.

properties.name: Acanthophora Spicifera
properties.description: My last plant would be Acanthophora spicifera. This is Red algae that are covered with many small spinelike branches. It is also red, brown, and dark green in color but turns yellow in bright sunlight. They are found in calm shallow reef flats, tidepools, and intertidal benches. They also use photosynthesize to survive.     Red algae are found throughout Florida, the Virgin Islands, and Puerto Rico. They can be found at depths of 22 meters. They cannot survive in freshwater like the blue-green algae can. They are also found in both tropical and subtropical habitats.

properties.name: Polyps
properties.description: "My first endangered animal is the polyps (pronunciation: pa-lips).They are little, tiny animals that swim to the place they want to live. They are also herbivores but they can only stretch out to eat their prey because once they found were they want to live. They cannot leave that spot. They also produce a type of limestone that sort of gushes out around them. That’s what glues them down so they cannot move. They also live with many other polyps. Once one dies, another one grows up on top of it. The polyps are found dead all over in coral reef zones. This is happing because of many reasons. Mostly because of humans (fisherman). Sometimes they use spear guns that may damage the coral reefs if hit. They also may use commercial poisons that kill the fish but also kill the tiny animal inside the coral reefs. They may even use dynamite that kills the polyps which also kills the coral reefs.

properties.name: Caribbean Monk Seal
properties.description: My second animal is the Caribbean monk seal. They were listed endangered on March 11, 1967.  Their populations were dipping below 1,200 and 500 individuals. There has been on real confirmer sightings of the monk seal since 1952. Now they are extinct because of human causes.      The Caribbean monk seal is the only subtropical seal native to the Caribbean Sea and Gulf of Mexico. The last sighting of the monk seal was in 1952 in the Caribbean Sea at Seranilla Bank, between Jamaica and the Yucantan Peninsula. They are about the size of the stray arctic seals. There had been protection services from many companies to try to save the seal. Now they are considered extinct.

properties.name: Shark
properties.description: Sharks in the coral reef zones are one of the more important keystone species in the coral reefs. Algae and tiny animals that produce the coral reefs are important but the sharks have a big rule of keep the fish population down. There are many types of sharks in one coral reef. Let alone the many others in the other coral reefs. Each of them are different but they all play the same rule as the other. Examples of some of the sharks is the Angelshark, Galapagos Shark, Lemon Shark, Nurse Shark, Sandtiger Shark (Sand Shark), Tiger Shark, Bullhead Shark, Blacktip Reef Shark, Eqaulette Shark, and Zebra Shark. Those are all examples of shark, that are different in all most every way and some live in different places but they all do the same thing. They keep the fish population down. Most of them live in shallow water off some coast. They eat fish and other animals small enough to eat.     The most important reason I pick a shark as a keystone specie is because they keep the fish population down. If the sharks were not there to keep the fish down. Their population would grow out of control in some places. That would be bad for the coral reefs and in time the coral reefs would die. After the coral reefs die there would be no home/food for the very tiny animals the need it to survive. They would then die. If they died then the bigger fish that eat them to survive would then die. In time then all/most of the fish and animals the once lived in the ocean would die and future generation would not get to see them. That’s why I pick a shark as the keystone specie.

properties.name: Background Information
properties.description: There are many coral reef zones. Unlike other biomes, coral reefs are found all over the world. They are found in tropical and semitropical oceans. To be more precise on were they are found, you can see around/in Hawaii, the Red Sea, and in Central America. The largest one is found over the cost of Queensland, Australia. This reef is called the Great Barrier Reef. Reefs are not found above or below latitudes up to about 30 degrees. There is one exception to that; Bermuda (at 32 degrees north latitude) has coral reefs because it lies in the path of the Gulf Stream’s warming water. Coral must have sunlight to survive, so you can find coral reefs at depths of approximately 70 meters and up. That mean you will find little if any out in the middle of the ocean.  Coral reefs also make a good barrier for bigger waves because of storms ect. When a bigger wave comes in toured land the reef acts like a barrier and breaks up the wave. So when it hits the shoreline it is a little wave that has little affect. There are many programs out there to help build reefs for that reason.     Coral Reefs live in the tropical and semitropical climates. Found in the Indo-Pacific and Atlantic. The optimal growth occurs when water temperatures are between 25-29 degrees Celsius. They grow in areas with sufficient sunlight and clear water. Waves are very smooth or very little of them, but coral can stand up to rough, big one when a storm comes.  Storms are common in some places (like the Caribbean and Gulf of Mexico. In other places they are storms are not as common.

properties.name: Landforms
properties.description: There are many different kinds of landforms in the coral reefs. Some of the landforms that coral reefs form are very special and can only be seen in the coral reef zones. The coral reef its self is a landform. There are many different types of coral all over the world. The biggest of them is the Great Barrier Reef. It is found in around Australia. There are also ridges and lagoons found around or in the coral reefs.

properties.name: Human Uses
properties.description: In my first paragraph I will talk about how humans us the biome. Humans use coral reefs in many ways. One way they use it is by tourism. When a town or city is located by/near the coral reefs, they use it in many ways. The first way they may use it is by seafood places located all over the city. Most are next to or close to the shoreline. That generates money and people like to go to them. Another way is by diving. People/business may have a course you can pass and suits to dive down to the coral reefs. The suits that you use would be rented, so you could not keep it. It would also cost money to just dive with the coral reefs/fish. That would generate money as well. One last really important way people use coral reefs in to make medicine. Scientist have found many plant/coral reefs that hold cures for many illness. One plant in the Great Barrier Reef has been found to cure a deadly cancer. So weather you are eating fish form it, diving to see it, or using it for a cure. Coral reefs are used in many ways buy humans.     Humans use the coral reefs for good but some times a good thing is too much. Humans can use the coral reefs to generate money by fishing. After you get the fish you can sell it for seafood. That is not a bad thing to do but in some area of the ocean, over fishing occurs. Over fishing cases destruction in the coral reefs. When you over fish, the fish that live there get taken out. Fish that don’t get taken out or don’t taste good get left behind. Most of those fish a plant/coral reefs eaters. When that happens there are not enough predators to eat the other fish. Those fish over eat the plant/coral reefs which cases the coral reefs to die. The second way humans kill coral is by bleaching. Bleaching is used to stun fish to catch but also used to make the coral look better. Companies that own or have permission from the government to bleach a section of the ocean (mostly around coral reefs) do this so it makes the coral reefs look better for divers.

properties.name: Agriculture
properties.description: The coral reefs provide us with many things. Many of them I have already talked about in other paragraphs. One thing I have really touched on is agriculture. Yes, coral reefs are located in the ocean but there have been some plants that grow underwater that are harvested by farmers that may grow them. Some examples of that would be different kinds of sea grass, kelp, and seaweed. You may not eat them directly but there are many thing out there that use things listed above that you don’t even no you are eating.      The coral reefs provide us with many things. Many of them I have already talked about in other paragraphs. One thing I have really touched on is agriculture. Yes, coral reefs are located in the ocean but there have been some plants that grow underwater that are harvested by farmers that may grow them. Some examples of that would be different kinds of sea grass, kelp, and seaweed. You may not eat them directly but there are many thing out there that use things listed above that you don’t even no you are eating.

properties.name: Tourist
properties.description: " Tourism in the coral reefs is good for the costal cities/towns because it attracts money.
